qHwSa9_n0-9NBqqt_5V0Wg.text: This place is amazing. The food never disappoints! Recommend the enchiladas and the burros, but everything is great here.

FNhnPvxKDRWTUbxkyU2UnA.text: First let me say I have been a customer for 20 years so it is with a broken heart that I give 2 star review.   And the only reason I did is because my server and the hostess were so nice.   I was in a party off 5 and 2 of the meals were not fresh.   My mom ordered a chimichanga and it came to the table soft,  not hot and crispy.   She dealt with it.   My best friend ordered the carnitas.  The plate and food were cold - beans, rice, meat - everything.   We were seated outside where the service is always slow (we expected it,  that always happens).  My best friend went to the hostess table to address the issue quickly and waited for 10 minutes before the waiter or manager would address her concern.   Then the manager - Eddie - copped an attitude and said she should have told her waiter, why was she telling the manager - at this point she still hasn't seen our waiter.  When she tried to explain she would have told our waiter if she had seen him at any point during her wait.   The manager then demanded to know what she wanted,  a replacement meal,  a comped meal or what.   He was so pissy she was nervous about getting "secret sauce" of she had a replacement plate, not to mention all of us were done eating by this point.   Such a disappointment.

YaB6IyH6oZ9lZZ-jlxTNnA.text: This restaurant was recommended by the front desk clerk at the Sheraton Crescent. She said it is their first recommendation for authentic Mexican food in the area. She described it as a mom and pop hole in the wall with great food. She was so right. I had a combination plate with a tamale, cheese enchilada and a beef taco. The enchilada sauce was exquisite with an amazing texture. The red chili beef tamale had a nice kick to it and the cheese enchilada was a nice balance on the plate. Also try one of their specialty margaritas.

GvjDc_ldvRa8K9xgXEIwCQ.text: The best Mexican food in the valley.  Looks can be deceiving.  This place has the best chips and salsa.  They have a wide variety of menu items.  I always go for the chicken enchiladas.

tJOo8aCfLtz1VJeJDl-PBw.text: My first trip to Via was about a year ago for a friend's birthday. I was kind of surprised that she chose this little place 45 minutes away from her home in Tempe, but immediately understood as I walked into the front door.   It's kitschy-cute, loud, unpretentious, and STACKED with hundreds of different options of tequila. What's not to love?  The veggie-friendly menu is pretty awesome, too, and definitely a huge plus for a sit-down Mexican food restaurant. I've literally had cravings just for their rice alone. So good!  The house margaritas are something ridiculous like $2 or $3 a piece but are pretty syrupy sweet. I ask for half the syrup and a splash of ice water, and they're actually drinkable.   This may not be a place you want to go to for a romantic date or a 'light' lunch, but it will be the place that resonates in the back of your mind anytime someone suggests grabbing Mexican food. Listen to that voice.

dA1UXDEwGzwMRPWrAu-_0g.text: Had lunch with a co worker that frequents the place.  Tacos, rice and beans were fantastic.  Jimmy the bartender is very friendly, and quick with service.  I'll definitely be going back.

vajkqLJObV0R-PtMDM7ibQ.text: This is one of the worst places. Really I can't believe that they expect people to pay for this stuf they serve as food. We ordered fajitas & were served scraps of meat. Also, for a Mexican food restaurant to serve guacamole from a package is a bad sign.

sSijk3C8hiRPMumvB9_gsg.text: Okay yes this place is not super trendy and yes the chips come on a plastic bowl but the food has been consistently good since I have been coming here for the past three years. When I want good, cheap authentic Arizona Mexican food I come here.  I am not sure why people are coming here expecting a high class joint.  It is in Sunnyslope and you park in a parking lot that you are not sure your car will be there when you return.  I promise it is still worth it.  The margaritas are good for what you pay and the pollo fundido is delish.

_yu1WvtcB6uk2poKROaoHw.text: Authentic old school Mexican restaurant. I love their albondigas and green chili burritos. Friendly staff and very well priced!

CVMIJacUPgNEgThhcMGiuA.text: This place should change its name to Via De Los Banos. Pull up a chair and prepare to swat flies away from your plate!

2JBufJ-hCVuNt01vc80qGQ.text: Lunch here yesterday. Service was terrible and my friend was served her lunch without utensils. She asked for utensils and the waitress left and did not return. I got up and asked the hostess and she gave me attitude. I didn't get what I ordered but ate it anyway. The food was good. The fly buzzing our table was not. I'll never go here again. Bad service.

zCQJKH4b6I2llFrLCMKfvA.text: Salsa had no heat, not even the hot one.   food was flavorless and over cooked.   Service was horrendous.   Nothing to say good things about.   Vegetable fajita had no seasoning and tasted canned and greasy.   Fish fajitas also lacked seasoning and fish was cut into small pieces and treated as though thawed.   Guacamole tasted store bought.  Would not recommend

BFmee7QSzJUloMDPOEns5A.text: An excellent choice for authentic Mexican food. The bottomless chips and salsa the waitress brought at the beginning of the meal were excellent. These were constantly refilled throughout our meal.   My personal favorites are the carne asada and the cheese, beef and jalapeno nachos. My dining companions enjoyed the chicken enchiladas and the cheese quesadillas. There is a list of tequilas available for every taste. They have Dos Equus Amber on tap (my favorite). The sopopillas for dessert are the best in Phoenix.  The decor is shopworn but comfortable. The service is very good without being intrusive. There is parking available in their lot or on the street. They accept credit cards.

gYBUfR3mdBLK92y3skMLxA.text: Excellent food. Charning atmosphere. Friendly staff. Cute bar attached. The chips are homemade-as is most everything else. Great prices, great portions. Well done margaritas and plenty of veggie options. Please note they do *not* use lard AND they are open 7 days a week. Some searches will tell you otherwise. Chalupas and Chili Rellenios are recommended!

h-HdEcFwOEvzVjT78gp4JQ.text: Another great experience  great bar happy patrons lots of regulars  to much food yo eat drinks a flowing truly a gem glad not too many peoe know about it.   If your up on central north of senator  Mcains .  Check this place out

hjAr53aua9sl2dxmL_ozZw.text: Not that bad but honestly a hybrid of Top Shelf, Garcia's, Manuels, Macayos.... Sorry, but really not sorry. It's just ok at best Mexican food. My wife had the #15 combo, 2 cheese enchiladas with rice and beans. I had #8, two shredded beef tacos, with rice and beans. Of course chips and salsa were served. The salsa was weak and was just a notch better than Pace. The taco sauce could have been from a jar also.  My tacos lacked any rich flavors, and not only were the shells stale, they were cracked beyond even being able to be held. Would have made a good taco salad. The rice and beans had an odd odor, which I think was old grease or lard. The beans were super bland and the rice was just nasty. If I am going to raise my cholesterol level, I usually expect top notch artery clogging fare. This isn't a place to obtain Crestor helping levels. Two other places are better if you ask me, hands down - Carolinas and Guadalajara.   I will leave this joint to the local area patrons looking to get their buzz on in a run down (basically a bar) joint slinging some premium tequila and cheap house Margs.  I don't think I will circa de Los santos instead of traveling via the saints!

_rVywGpM-imOmKG6IkRE_g.text: Not the same as it used to be.  Watered down margaritas and food was just ok.  We used to come once a week.  Not anymore.  Seems like new management?

3mX2mFBDpMYaZ81ryuWKzw.text: By far the best Mexican food in Phoenix!  I'm partial to Mexican food in Tucson but was wowed tonight!  Eddie is awesome and I can't wait to bring my whole family here!  So good!  Thank you for the great service and amazing food!

TwMkWcFG9nhHqNFjg4yZ7Q.text: Awesome, best Mexican food I've had. Asked the hotel Consiair for the best local Mexican restaurant and they recommend this hidden gem. Don't be fooled by the exterior because the staff and food are primo.

iHpaPUNMtqWdDjLbeay0gA.text: Most definitely a whole in the wall place, the food is very good.  On a recent visit the waiter suggested the cabbage and corn enchilada. Since then I've ordered them, they are very tasty.  The cheese crisps are a good appetizer to get you started as well, great variety.

GFnYZZsBUbp3oR9twGd5kQ.text: Bad service slow service seriously how long does it take to serve a glass of wine and a tostada ? Well I guess about 53 minutes !  NEVER EVER again..

gZyD3eXDpILTu3Hl4h6sjg.text: I personally think this little place is great .. I love the old school hole in the wall Mexican joints ! If your looking for fine dinning or expecting fine dinning then move along .. but if you want good dive authentic Mexican food , the kind where everything is touching and melts together then this IS your place to stop and try ! And did I mention the margaritas are only $3.50 ?! Kinda syrupy sweet , but aren't all house margaritas anywhere you go ?

Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Obviously a Margarita
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tostada , taco and enchilada

NVx0potyk_4BZu0mpO-Eeg.text: I had a chicken burro enchilada style with guacamole. It had absolutely no flavor. With so many good Mexican restaurants around there is no reason to eat here.

ynVOlNEHZNxxiUhs1RCtXQ.text: I'm a huge fan of Via Delosantos, and not only because it's about a 5 minute walk from my house. Their house margaritas are only $3. Are they the best margaritas you'll ever have? Probably not. They're a little sweet and made with a mix. But will they get you drunk? You're damn right they will. And for the price, you really can't beat that. They make it easy for you if you want to turn any of their 50+ nicer tequilas into a margarita: just add $2 to the shot price.   As for the food, I've never been disappointed. Some things are better than others though. Their Pollo Fundido is truly the best in town. I've never had a better tamale, and they have red and green sauces. I believe the red is vegetarian friendly, so when I had my veggie friend visiting, she was happy to have an authentic tamale to try. My husband and I mixed it up last time we went and split the Super Mexican Pizza, which was surprisingly good. It was on a huge tortilla and had machaca beef, tomatoes, green onions and black olives. Ask for a side of sour cream and you'll be in heaven. One mexican pizza, a margartia, a Dos Equis and tip= $25. Not bad for a night out for two, and we even had a few pieces leftover. Personally, I didn't care for their guacamole. It just seemed like mashed up avocado to me, no especially interesting additions, so that's the one thing I'd steer clear of.   I don't personally know what "real" Mexican food is...I've never been to Mexico. All I know is my husband and I have been told by several people from Mexico that we're lucky to live by one of the best authentic places in Phoenix. So take that as you will.  The place is a little run down, but to me that's part of the charm. I love sitting in the little back room, it has a more personal feel. They get pretty busy around dinnertime on the weekends, but the wait never seems to be more than 10-15 minutes. Fair warning: They close at 9:30, even on Saturdays, which is pretty annoying. I thought the hours listed here couldn't possibly be right, but I called and confirmed.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dos Equis Amber

F-BYgQef0QzKQHqGd4Gw1A.text: Dinners were good, but chips where stale!  Tables are way to close together, (we were shoved in a corner with 4 people). We did not get refills until we were done with our dinner...  It was just not a Pleasant evening. We have not eaten here for years, and I don't see us returning...

Pbv-0oWEC1FtUSYCaLOAJw.text: I have been going here for approximately 20 years, and considered it one of the top 5 Mexican food restaurants in the valley.  No more.  When I went tonight the first thing I noticed that 20-25% of the menu was blacked out, particularly the part about the flavorings in the dishes served. And it was True, the food is now bland. And the service is now atrocious.  My friend,  who also goes there with me frequently,  also agreed the restaurant has taken a turn for the worse. When I questioned our server she replied, "We are going through changes. " Definitely will never return or recommend this to my friends.

Qd-tFXDZkHQSK5gXa4auJw.text: This bar must have the largest selection of tequilas in the west with 180 choices. The bartender mentioned, at one point they had over 300. I was introduced to this one of a kind establishment by a friend and immediately became a big fan!!  Small in size it packs a huge impression, as you walk in and admire the abundance of premium tequilas on display. Inside the bar, empty tequila bottles hang upside down from the ceiling that surrounds a cozy bar. Ordered the Tacos, because that's what goes best with tequila & beer and they've done themselves proud to make a great tasting crispy taco!  Prices for food and tequila match the quality of choices, but it can get expensive if you enjoy top shelf tequila. Can't wait to come back and sample other unique choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shelf display of premium tequilas as you walk in

jCrNpKWUhZmwhpW3f_wuOw.text: About as close to authentic old timey Tex Mex as Phoenix has to offer. Drinks are affordable as is the food. Lots of different tequilas. If you like trendy avocado Cali Mexican recommend you stay away (please). This place is traditional tacky, but if you like this style you won't be disappointed. Been seeing more and more German cars in the parking lot lately. Ugh.

mNYtYWl1NyA0vhaziFi2gQ.text: The best home made Mexican food in Phoenix great service fresh ingredients super nice server. Delish!

Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmm great food I got the burrito and beef taco so good !

8wHoj60MZTg5V6A8Giuw7A.text: This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant in town. Great food. Great service. They have happy hour specials Also lunch specials.

Qg3Ad7UqKeYcHIc6O7fL_A.text: This is my 5th visit,  the food is great and seems to get better with each visit.  Does not disappoint.   Love their chilaquiles be sure to add a fried egg.  Enjoy!

2mq7LGsg1yjJMNmWlqXfBw.text: I'm going to miss this place!! Amazing workers and food is delicious! My all time favorite Mexican restaurant!!

mMHDDANaBbwr0FMWrmtkeQ.text: I have been coming to Via de Los Santos for 28 years. Food is amazing Sonoran style, margaritas are delicious and fairly priced and the service is great! However, I had to give them a 3 star rating based on food portions. I have noticed that the food portions are getting smaller and smaller every time. Not on all dishes but on those that require fish or meat. I've noticed that they have increased their prices (understandable) but either you increase the prices or reduce the portions but never both. I hope management notice and make some modifications.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Via de Los Santos Super Mexican shredded beef pizza...where is the meat??? Not to mention not much of the other ingredients.

7YRe_F6_3vBtsp5MnOYqng.text: This is NOT real Mexican food..it is TOURIST Mexican food.  Look at the pictures here if you do not believe me...typical rice, beans, lettuce, flour, and NO MEAT.  A good place to do if you have relatives in town and want to get rid of them...take them here and they will go away in a hurry...

TEaNBnQGD2IyngPyhOx7sQ.text: Best salsa anywhere - great chips - perfect service! Definitely going back!

kgsnGCqyyTi_eRG9bDEp7g.text: Too much flour in the sauce. I want them to do well, but they need to put more flavor--spices, herbs-- and less fat.

mnjgjVwic3tXsPq53DfTMg.text: Never ever fails to disappoint for the best Mexican food in the valley. It's been open for many years, it's family owned, and the quality is great. I always skip the bar after my youthful failed frozen margaritas and just go for the combos on the huge menu. Their enchiladas are excellent and the owner is so nice!

WFJJFaTqIJJ_4S4eNVRWig.text: The salsa is by no means hot, but always taste fresh and delicious.  As for the notorious .99$ margaritas... I think they are now $2 but still definitely get you messed up and are tasty enough for only 2 bucks. It puts some people off that the margaritas are poured from a tap like a draft beer, but once you have two or three you are fine with it.  I witnessed such a lady make an issue with the draft margarita who insisted on having it shaken in a cocktail shaker. The bartender reassured the senorita that this was the house margarita that everyone was enjoying. She just couldn't wrap her head around it. I wanted to say "Listen lady, Its $2... and it will get you fucked up, just enjoy it"! But my reserved nature dictated otherwise. The atmosphere and the food are above average, standard Sonora Mexican fare that is not very spicy.  The location is ideal if your buddie's girlfriend is having a baby at John C. Lincoln hospital and you want to have the "Holy Shit! your a Dad" talk over 3 pitchers of margaritas. Because when you are done he can just walk back over to the maternity ward while you finish your green chile quesadilla.

PRxcQtcHZ7n_hQDgCVJwkg.text: I have never heard of Via Delosantos but my sister told me the food was amazing and she was shocked I have never heard of this place. While I was waiting to be seated I pulled up Yelp on my phone and started reading reviews. Arik B's review was funny as hell but also scared the shit out of me. The chips and salsa were good but not great. The rice and beans were blah. The vegetarian chalupa had a lot of guacamole on it topped off with lettuce and cheese. I can't believe they even serve this on the menu it's horrible. My cheese enchilada topped of with their white queso sauce was really good so if I ever get dragged to this place again I will order that. During dinner my sister mentioned that she has seen roaches in the restaurant while she was eating and In my head I was thinking " Dammit Arik B was right"!

bsFnJb8gd0mK16FGvDHAMQ.text: i really hate this place.  but i have spent a lot of time here.  cheap drinks. decent salsa. and old men who buy these drinks for you is what keeps me coming back.

PWpLyNgo8L0EMQehb78xIw.text: This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant in Phoenix.  I was introduced to this place when I first moved to Arizona, and has been my go to place for Mexican food since.  Whenever I get company in town to visit I always make sure this is a trip we make out to eat.  Great food, decent prices, and love the atmosphere.

OSWleWbcZzsYShJv8l678Q.text: the salsa was very spicy, the chips  were luke  warm, liked their green pork   burrito. the green corn  tamales were dry and hard . rice was overcooked. i would rate  the restaurant  a little better than average, service was attentive

OtyUH74-jX_kLwwxW-GXOA.text: update, and a warning to you.  repeat visit 1: a nickel in the nachos, not a dime, a fucking nickel....last i check this is a major health violation.  repeat visit 2:  egg shells in my Chorizo Burrito.   on a positive note: i didn't see any insect diners on my table. but i didn't look underneath it in fear of seeing a swarm. remember that movie Candyman..remember the bee's in the toilet...yea that gives you a mental picture.  this place must have some serious pull to not have been shut down by now.

bs-YL6QX73_I2hDi9NZlDQ.text: Delicious! definately a little hole in the wall but its great! haven't ordered anything I didnt like :) a must try.

4gY0yVbhwUJch-nGOUOAOQ.text: My husband took me to this place for our first date nearly 8 years ago, and we've been regulars since. Yes, it's not the fanciest Mexican food,  but that's not why we're regulars...the food is good and cheap, the margaritas are excellent, and my whole family is addicted to their salsa. Great joint that I hope stays in Phoenix for a long, long time.

o8GztAlpDT-q4qg6MJylUQ.text: This is basically a one or two star dive that gets 4 food stars for an extensive menu dotted with quirky vegetarian options rarely seen on a Mexican menu.  Several dishes feature calabacitas (zucchini), corn, cabbage,etc. - including a calabacitas stroganoff type dish over a bed of egg noodles (instead of spanish rice), which was filling and tasty.  I'm not vegetarian - I just think it's different and interesting. The salsa is also unusually good.   Our service has been below average more than once and the atmosphere inside can be quite dark and dreary. Once, a guy in the front of the parking lot was trying to sell his shotgun in broad daylight.  I dont say that to imply any sense of danger as to convey the marginal Sunnyslope surroundings that might offend certain sensibilities.    I'm glad I tried Via Delosantos.  We still joke about the shotgun, and the menu's a kick. But I dont plan on returning anytime soon...not unless someone puts a gun to my head

upsYWRJiNhOTLs1yqDMOnQ.text: I've been coming here for quite awhile...and I like...a lot. Took some out of town guests here on Sunday night, and they loved it. We took a seat in the bar, and the bartender was on the ball. Hot chips arrived quickly along with a couple of their $2.99 margaritas! Yum! Two of us had the enchilada plate (one of us had green, the other red) and the other guy had the carnitas plate. No complaints here! Delicious! And if you are a tequila lover...there are hundreds to choose from! Really.

qYzwBJYOH06kOTz-2pScbw.text: Via is a lot like that 10 year old beat up Honda Civic that got you through college and the first crappy job after. It's pretty reliable, you don't really want people to see you drive up in it, it's better than nothing at all, but you're always thinking about that time when you can finally get something better. Highs = chips/salsa and the margaritas. Lows = same old cheese and bean mess you always see and a nasty bathroom and smell at times. It's the North Central version of Tee Pee. Head South and go to Gallo Blanco if you have the time.

_2ddFyOqzph-zoGF0TJ-3g.text: I'm a native Phoenician, and this is my favorite Sonoran-style Mexican restaurant in the Valley. If it was just the food, I'd give it 5 stars. However, the service sometimes lacks and it doesn't always feel like the cleanest place, so 4 stars it is...  The salsa is great - flavorful with just the right amount of heat. I usually wind up eating way too much of it before my meal arrives. My two favorite items are the cheese enchilada and green chili corn tamale, enchilada style. At a lot of places, the red sauce is too tomato-y for my taste, but Via's is the most authentic I've found. I'm not really a fan of red beef tamales, but I tried a bite of the vegetarian green chili corn tamale when we ordered the appetizer sampler platter once while dining with some friends from out of town, and I was hooked. Now we order a dozen of them for Thanksgiving each year.  The Mexican pizza, pollo fundido, fajita burrito, and calabacitas are also very good. Disappointingly, one thing I would pass on is the guacamole - it's bland and creamy to the point of being a paste.   If you aren't familiar with this area, as other reviewers have noted, it's not necessarily in the best part of town. However, I worked in the area for years, and it's still worth the trip. There are parts of town I would definitely hesitate to venture into, but this isn't one of them.

sAapcMmagyleokOC4Okixw.text: I eat here once a week and have been for several years. In all that time I have yet to have a bad meal or service. I have eaten at dozens of places in Phoenix but this is our favorite spot. Good solid Mexican food that is consistent. There are fancier places, but no one beats the price and service.

1eWtmuWRtGP2j0jD1Prlhw.text: I actually love this place, very good food and excellent salsa.  Its a little seedy around the gills but has the biggest selection of tequila in the world.  99c margaritas are good but small, salsa's are very tasty with the gratis chips.  I'm not a vegetarian by any means but DO get the repollo and corn enchilada....its a fantastic mix of grilled cabbage and corn on a tasty tortilla.   mmmm, fabulous!

s2z7bZILbzWzlsrE7RRmzg.text: Amazing cheap margaritas! I've been a fan of this place since I was little! Really great mexican food and the best salsa around. Always a fun trip in with friends!

J0T7Jew5tX05Sj_gVk0l3w.text: Above average food & average service, but it made me feel like I was in a Rocky Point dive bar.  Who doesn't love Rocky Point?  Good margs and a ton of tequilas to choose from.  Pricing on food was more than fair for the quality and portions.

FKYg2mEJx9mx4i2RoIdN4A.text: So a normal Friday night with family and friends turns into worst nightmare imaginable.  First of all Mexican Pizza was cold, meat was dry, and olives taste like rubber.  Service was substandard with waitress bringing extra drinks without request.  Owner at 11:00 is drunk or something, starts a fight with a patron across the bar from me.  I witnessed the scrum started by the owner and other employees.  The owner is lucky he is not being sued by the man he struck. I immediately left with my wife in case things got worse.  Definitely not a place I would recommend!  Please stay away from there at all cost, something isn't right...

URla14RLbrK3srZu2y5HyA.text: The largest tequila selection in Phoenix puts this place high on the list of my favorite North Central Phoenix mexican food spots. It is awesomely tacky, and the crowd at Via Delosantos is always ready to have a good time. Of course, it's hard NOT to have a good time when they have great margaritas for 99 cents at Happy Hour.   The food is good, the service is good, but the drinks and drink specials are (*) great. (expletive deleted)

yrySUMtAqwKUQ6eqLWX5PA.text: Who can complain when you're dealing with 99 cent margaritas? After I order a couple and a large fried quesadilla, I'll even forget that I recently read Via Delosantos received the worst report in 2004 for their numerous major Health Department violations!

RaYmMTCB-CSU0gCH-6rNng.text: Very good chips and salsa and great green chili! And believe it or not, one of the best cheeseburgers I've ever ate! And oh those margaritas... what a bang for only 3 bucks!  It's very old and eclectic looking, and the service can be a bit spotty on very busy nights, but we love this place.

P4CZFLpKMH747-7AGUUAyA.text: Went here last night with the hubby. It was recommended by several people. It is definitely an old school place. Older crowd too. The food was amazing. I had the muchaca chimichanga and it was the best one I think I ever had. Very flavorful. And the prices were so good! We are absolutely going back.

VekE2IrxIkQAgAoaDZGnYw.text: The waiter was very helpful and suggested the Pollo Fundido.  Got it and it was amazing!  The chips and salsa were also very good and a few Mexican beers helped things go down smoothly.

YccBjuqNs73hFCxZ9ZPHww.text: The Via Mexigo was an excellent sampler, the staff friendly and attentive. Two salsa dips, crisp chips.

gWA9D1OTb6h6ubA-wrzTig.text: This is out go to Mexican place. The food is the usual choices but taste is good . They accommodate my active 2 year old well but they are always busy!

9sRZy54eaRwGEay6sJV-dQ.text: Terrible!! My wife dragged me here once again last month for her birthday and it was our last!! Here's how the nite went - sat down waited 15 minutes before we flagged down a busboy for chips and water. Chips came out hot and fresh with some tastey salsa! Thats when we should have left! We finish our chips and salsa - still no waitress, no menus and no waters!! And not just us mind you, the entire section!! Finally, a waitress gets to us and asks are you ready to order? Again, no water and no menus!! After another ten minutes makes her way back with water and menus and we order. Food comes out in five flat!! Precooked slop! Fish tacos stunk! No flavor - all fishy smell! Heres the kicker - shes drops a check on the table when we start eating and then gone again! She never comes back - no refills, no boxes for the kids meals, nothing! Again, this is the entire section!!! Well, I was going to skip out on the bill but, I paid and of course left her zero tip! NEVER, NEVER, NEVER, AGAIN!! My wife even apologized to me about going there - on her birthday no less!! AVOID! THIS PLACE SUCKS!!!

3-Fekxv-ZIY7iOsi8Mrusg.text: I agree with the other reviewers that the appearance of this place may turn some people away, but that is all the better for you because you will get a table faster.  If you go on the weekends prepare to wait 20-40 minutes, but it is indeed worth it.  The food is very good and the service is hit or miss but what impressed me most is the wide selection of Vegetarian dishes.  I am not vegetarian but some of my friends are and sometimes I just feel like eating something lighter.  They have a great selection of grilled veggie filled burritos.  You can also get sides of grilled veggies like asparagus, zucchini and carrots.  Be sure to try the grilled carrots.  The parking sucks,  the servers are sometimes not nice and the place sort of looks like something in a bad dream featuring Antonio Banderas and a mariachi band,  but the food will keep you coming back.

IFtDA4z2P1uNIFobyG1t_A.text: This used to be my favorite Mexican food restaurant in Phoenix.  About a year ago my husband and I both became violently ill a few hours after eating there, and after reviewing what we ate in common determined it had to be the salsa.  So we stayed away until Sat. night when we decided to give it a try again.  The place has always been scary by its appearance but we were amazed how much it had run down in just a year.  Everything was dirty, from the floors on up, including the inch of grime covering all the crap hanging on the walls, which keeps them from really cleaning or putting a badly needed fresh coat of paint on the place.  There are holes in the booths with stuffing spilling out and there was a big smear of dried salsa on the mirror hanging right next to my head.  All very unappealing!  Add to that stale, tough tortilla chips, a very bland green chili burro and watered-down Margarita and I'm writing off an old favorite.   Unless you really like the dangerous feeling you get when you walk into a border town dive, stay away!

rZe_jKS2mqjKPOEmzZncGA.text: I cannot say one bad thing about this place. Just get there early because the wait can be ridiculous. I love everything on the menu, but my family and I share the via mexico dinner most of the time. We share dinners because the chips and salsa are amazing!! yum-o.

FtynvER4i7khWS5N_zUf7Q.text: Wonderful food and drinks. Completly family run authentic mexican with super generous portions.

LAPSvi-8UcXRdxre1Pt23Q.text: This is my favorite salsa in town, right now.  The old adage holds True: the less impressive the architecture, the more impressive the food.  You're not going to impress your boss with this Phoenix gem, but for an afternoon of $3 margaritas, or a BIG plate of flavorful food Via Delosantos can't be beat!

RBJ9CKngh9fnFn2nb8723Q.text: Yes, yes and yes. We love the kitchy Mexican decor, local drunks at the bar and awesome Phoenician staff. As residents of the (re)developing neighborhood, we couldn't be happier with this restaurant. The happy hour menu is big enough to call it dinner. The margaritas definitely do their job and are delicious to boot! Good place to meet up with friends and hang for a few hours. They serve green corn tamales, which is becoming rare for Mexican places and something we greatly appreciate!!!

BYdKUhII_BOAbxrGsMzs4A.text: Really slow service, people too busy talking and not enough serving. I had to leave and didn't even order cause they were so slow and unaccommodating

20JoFJjKHgYyG4ZJUH4khg.text: If I can add a half I totally would be at a 3.5 on this place.  The Mexican food is probably the best I have had in Phoenix.  The price is very good.  The service was fair, skip the guac but I would recommend two magaritas.

PC4qjPv7HDbq__Xv6hqzIA.text: One of our favorite Mexican food restaurants in the valley.  Stay away from the Americanized dishes; instead go for the corn and cabbage enchiladas with while sauce, egg noodles covered in green chili, and assorted tamales.

_9yj8N8rT7-LEbXzfY4CAQ.text: I am a big fan of the green chile. I have never really had good service here, but the good food makes me not mind as much. I had lunch there today. The food was served less than 5 minutes after I ordered it. The food was hot and fresh. However, the server never asked how the food was or asked if I would like a drink refill. If you are looking for good food then I recommend it. If you are all about great service then skip it.

kAKihLOuJO5gylRBJkfppg.text: It's not exactly authentic but definitely unique in it's own sense.  The have a decent amount of vegan/vegetarian options especially for a Mexican restaurant.  The service is fantastic.

cybno1ZPmSixRBPVh12N6w.text: I enjoyed my meal here. I did not see any roaches like Arik claimed. I did however find the place to be old and somewhat run down. What do you expect from an old family style Sonoran Mexican restaurant. Their salsa is tasty, and the burrito enchilada style was great. I'd go back but It's not on my short list. It's just okay.

JfZyblFeJYWuJlzI5kcjrw.text: Was in Phoenix this week on business and had my favorite soup.  It is still YUMMY!!!  I love this place!

ZNcEx2VjMteqv0PnHEOA7w.text: Overall I like their food. Lots of chips and great salsa..both hot and mild. always free and as many as you can eat. Beer is cold cold cold. staffer pleasant and prompt. great with drink refills. All items are delicious. Sopapillas...really good.  Best mexican food around. Pleasant , casual atmosphere and not expensive. good value for the money.

mRW7O-kmCKPHG3M538RwlQ.text: My boyfriend and I love this place. As a vegetarian, I love that I have lots of options, from asparagus enchiladas to burritos stuffed with spinach, potatoes, carrots or cabbage. Also, if you get a burrito and like spicy food, ask for grilled jalapenos inside. It's worth it. My boyfriend always gets a combo plate with a chile relleno, a cheese enchilada and a beef taco, all of which he loves. The staff has always treated us very well, and the food keeps us coming back for more.

Tk_Qaiq_XLOek7rb5GQ6Kw.text: I was absolutely shocked by the experience I had at this restaurant today. My friends and I were ordering some food, mostly drinks, and sitting in a table in the bar area. The bartender was amazing- so friendly and efficient; however, a while into our meal, an old woman aggressively asks us if we are planning on ordering any more food. We said no, and she said that we had to pay and leave because they needed the table for other people that would be ordering food. I was so appalled; not only were we spending good money on multiple drinks and food, but we were not being noisy or inappropriate. I have worked in restaurants as a waitress for years and I have never seen someone be so disrespectful. There was no explanation, no compromise, no apology, nothing. She was extremely abrasive and rude about it. It's unfortunate because I was hoping to come back again regularly, but after that experience, I will be going somewhere else.

A2-1zEp2ygKynB8nJY-wNQ.text: The "manager" Jamie refused my take out order and sent me back out into the rain with no food. This place smells like cigarettes. :'D

cPCmUOntllDPgbWuXlp82g.text: Not as good as it once was. Last two visits have been disappointing with cold food and poor service. Recipes are sound but the staff seems burned out. Via con Dios amigos, we are taking our weekly business elsewhere.

H1s58cHPU5RyGZvSDTakhw.text: Lots of character. Food was good. Waiter was attentive. My beef Flauta was better than the chicken. But think they used corn tortillas rather than flour.   Lots of food choices.   Mom liked her Chile relleno and cheese enchilada.   Bathroom could use some updating.   Would definitely return.

1lWUNf6vjYvmsCUMIrc-mw.text: Cool restaurant with really good Mexican food. Huge menu lots of variety and choices. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because my pollo fundito was dark meat chicken and I expected Breast meat. My mistake for not asking, usually it is chicken breast. Our mucho macho meat burrito was very good. Great chips and salsa and excellent friendly staff.

5X0EFdjhEzyoxniqGWRauQ.text: Although not modern this place is a little gem in north central Phoenix non stop chips and salsa food comes out quickly and plates are always hot I the winter we have menudo and it has never disappointed keep up the good work

2_7F8ASNi9HhwhhpFvjIYg.text: Fantastic old restaurant with great Mexican food.  Everything seemed to have a very special authentic touch even though you might find some of these items in some of the ordinary popular Mexican restaurants.  Their selection of Tequila is worth the trip by itself.  Ask to see if they still do the sampler.  This place will always be a destination several times a year.  Parking may be a slight problem if busy, but drive around a bit and you shouldn't have a problem.

D0B-BI8KsDz16XIHMJbyfg.text: Great margaritas at a good price. spicy chorizo dip it delicious. Staff is really friendly and fast service

zqY4rFknlKsjszvzklYyVA.text: SO DISAPPOINTED!  Our family frequently ate here for 20+ years and loved it. However, our experience this evening was awful.  The chips & salsa, beans & rice were the best part of our meal.  One family member ordered the Pollo Fundido -- sauce tasted like Velveta cheese melted, no punch whatsoever!  The meat seemed to be about a tablespoon of white meat chicken mixed in with tuna!  My salad was swimming in red sauce from the cheese enchilada -- the cheese was not even melty.  Will not be returning. Maybe they should return to a menu offering fewer items and 'doing it right'!

Iukw8QRHs2b7gjnVK2SJew.text: Unfortunately I don't have anything really good or bad abt this place. It was just ok. Although the chips were great. The food was pretty basic. I didn't like that I was served a margarita in a non margarita glass

0gl631pWDDXZ9s9tWfSeCA.text: Great local place with great food. True Tex-Mex queso with chorizo is awesome!   Everyone super nice. Would definitely come back again!

VxQCLjnRhvVUVllNwr3djA.text: One of our favorite hangout spots. Tortilla chips and salsa made fresh daily. Roman street tacos are yummy. Love to go on a hot summer day cause the A/C is ice cold in the bar area. Sure, the place is worn but it has character. A pitcher of margs and some DosXX and you won't want to leave this place!

4S3rxLe3VSKQ11eaxHS_Hg.text: I can't wait to go back!!! I had the pollo fundido and it was amazing!! I would want to try something else next time but I'm Kinda craving the pollo fundido already!! Definitely going back next time we are in the area!! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7AsxrlyRgIAuwnVP9nsSvA.text: Great bar; particularly for day drinking!  Dingy, dirty and glass hasn't been cleaned since....well maybe never, but the bar has character that is solely lacking in many spots today. Tacos are good and menu seems pretty affordable. Only had Tacos but other food I saw come out looked bomb, and portions were pretty bigly! As for the question below inquiring about 'Gender Neutral Restrooms"? They have a Men's room for Men and a women's room for women, which is all they need.

VNb3TY641opBiOMZbPnAGw.text: Absolutely perfect! Our waitress Grace was awesome. We had a party of 10 our service was flawless.

9cbGnDQkWKLOlKlgPxQXjA.text: Coming from Texas I have to say this place one of the best Mexican places I have had since moving to Phoenix.

BgDxD2twjbmh0ctCCqa0iQ.text: I love their green chile, it's wonderful as with their other dishes. It's not often that I can get authentic Mexican food. My only wish would be if they could update and remodel the restaurant.

uXcdwO75CLESYMrF4T2dFw.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix!! I absolutely love the food and the service is always great. I've tried a ton of items on the menu and have never been disappointed.

VbnFFTv7Rafp11lHritgoA.text: I love this place. They don't use lard in their beans and it's very vegan friendly. They even have a full veggie menu and their salsa is to die for.

8a5nuN-NTSRXp1wjWhuJ_Q.text: My new favorite spot.  Absolutely amazing Mexican food and service. My albondigas soup was perfect and the fresh tortillas are to die for.  Green chile here is bursting with flavor  and the salsa is on point!

me0gbt_WkQNfo2hao9PPkA.text: If you want the full-on Sonoran Mexican food experience, this is your place. Everything on the menu is good.  They do the classics (chimichangas, enchiladas, tacos, etc.) just right.  Their margaritas and tequila selection are excellent.

uYR6zGgtxdIASenARdc4YQ.text: Excellent food and atmosphere. Tequila selection is the most ive ever seen, probably my favorite Mexican restaurant, sit in the bar if you can-small but fun.

D3pct8ayD5vpBl-W6fCsPw.text: Food was okay nothing to rave about.  Sorry to say not authentic Mexican food.  Typical Mexican food served at a Mannys or Macayos.  Hostess not very friendly, servers said we could not order from her, it had to be from waitor/waitress.  Instead of saying "Let me get her/him for you" she walked away.  More attention needs to be paid to cleaning as restaurant was dirty, walls very dirty.  Pretty sure I will not be coming back.

D9XRP6bbOObAx4olSKoGiw.text: Pretty typical sit down mexican cuisine. It isn't super authentic, but it is better than those other commercialized places like Azteca.  I would put this on fighting ground with that Irish Mexican place on 16th st. (i forget it's name). definitely would prefer this place. it is more hole in the wall.  Food has HUGE servings. I walked away happy.  The green chili quesadilla isn't bad (not the best i've had though)

E0Lh-KmmRWkwp5mP1d3Lwg.text: Great place! This is Arizona style Mexican food, not the snooty $12 taco plate stuff.  Atmosphere isn't fancy, it's Authentic.

D4S2V1N-LYO3zFnBdnqqEA.text: Best Mexican food in Phoenix.  I have lived here for over 25 years and have been around most of the well known Mexican food places  from upscale Scottsdale to dive South barrio.  Via De is the best there is.  Their Pollo Fundido is the best and their burro selection can't be beat.  My favorite dish is the Calupas with a side of grilled corn.  If you are looking for the best Mexican food in a casual family friendly environment or if you like a W I D E variety of Tequilas to choose from, come here  I know they don't serve any IPA's, but hey, Mexican food deserves a Mexican beer or a margarita anyway.

WqpeoUtSie21yNK86wOc3w.text: No good service. And good was not good and house margarita was nasty. I won't be back

ujT_7dwjmrlSP_839CKIxw.text: Oh my! This was an unexpected find! And to think I almost missed it! You will see a ton of elderly white people going into this hidden gem-- but do not be afraid! It is not one of those bland, Mexican for people who don't know anything about Mexican food places.  You know what I'm talking about.  And I know I'm probably ageist and racist or whatever, but when I see only white folks over the age of 65, I think bland.  I think Taco Bell and chimichangas.  Sorry, that's been my experience. Well... This is not that kind of place! OMG! The fry bread with green chile stew was the start of our gluttony, but it was only the start.  The chile rellenos were outstanding.  The huevos con chorizo-- awesome.  The beans and rice on the side-- perfect.  Chips and salsa were also way better than average.  Next time, I think I'll just have them bring me a trough of the obscenely good green chile stew!  I am too stuffed right now to contemplate it.  I can't make this a habit or I'll be buying bigger pants.  Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.  Though you may have to get bigger pants...

uMkPm9Nr6z9BP96B56tQOA.text: Waited 15 min it wasn't even crowed they sat us down nobody waited on us for another 15 min. We got up & left very dirty & old. We checked out the kitchen which was gross

TOeA0O4lIQOwD7yNVirkjg.text: WoW! Wowie, wow! Food was sooooo good. Tastes authentic, it's rare I can actually say that. Chips & salsa=great.  Chips were thin, warm & fresh. So many tequila choices...OH MY! I had a margarita=$3 good. The pollo funido burrito dinner was so yummy, two can share it. It's delish and a LOT! Tried the beef flautas, they were ok. Beans and rice were done perfectly. Place is yummy and worth the trip and cost. Will venture out again sometime.

QffNmhJ7H9SF7vz3A-8tJw.text: Been coming here for years... probably my favorite North Central Phoenix Mexican 'comfort food' restaurant.  Great homey decor, HUGE tequila selection, good chips and salsa.  Delicious enchiladas, tortas, combos.  Good margueritas and good Mexican beer selection.   Recommended.

lmqKDyF1WtgaFsG9-t6E9A.text: Disappointing, to say the least.  Mediocre (cold) chips and salsa.  Good Margarita (I upgraded to Milagro tequila).  I asked my waitress what she recommended (beef fajitas) and tried everything on the plate, but I will not be bringing the leftovers (lots!)  home.  They can put in the garbage or "re-gift"!!!  I don't understand how/why this place has so many great reviews....no atmosphere, run-of-the-mill Mexican food, average service.  Will not be returning...too many really good Mexican food restaurants in the valley.

U3dR0hzTVzcRZ8MjLTi0EQ.text: Always on point. Best pollo fondito in town and amazing service. We love this little cantina!

k6zbnXlUeLPMrMnOOPmqQg.text: Wow!  I have stayed away from this restaurant for some time, because my last few visits would rank at around a 2.  This most recent visit was closer to a 3.5 stars, but I'm giving them the 4 because of the vast improvement over my prior visits.  A couple weeks ago I found myself "stuck" going here.  I hoped for the best and was a good sport.  We ordered a cheese crisp and shredded taco appetizers.  A basic House Margarita, frozen, was good.  The cheese crisp was super crispy and the perfect balance of bubbly hot cheese to tortilla ratio.  The tacos were the best I have ever had at this location.  Service was a little slow, but competent.  So, I can say that I was PLEASANTLY SURPRISED by this most recent visit.  More cautious optimism, less avoidance, for now.

oQ1dz0KD4iBmTpPZ1sdmuQ.text: We love this restaurant because the food is home style Mexican and the atmosphere is fun and what I expect with great Mexican food.  Absolutely love the lady bartender on Friday nights.  Her margaritas are second to none.  There is usually a wait but it is truly worth it.

0dCH55ivNF_uKlTaeJeU-A.text: This is our FAVORITE restaurant. I celebrated my birthday and they made us feel special! Before Darling Son, we came every week. We don't eat our as often now, but De Los Santos remains our go-to spot. There are fantastic choices for vegetarians as well as plenty of meat for the omnivores! Do it!

PqbPyGDH_IVimfyc7dC3dA.text: IN LOVE! This hole in the wall is amazing. Don't let the appearance lead you a stray! the staff is awesome and always waiting on you in a quick manner. The food is great authentic food that is very fresh. The margaritas are fantastic and very cheap. I need to learn to venture out on this menu, but I usually stick with what I know and order a number nine. I love bringing out of state family here to experience this gem. I might become a well known customer real soon as the pace I enjoy eating here.

ATfglSLcj614Pf_sPOI87A.text: They had me at fresh tortilla chips.  SO.  AMAZING. I personally love the flautas and guac, but everything is amazing (and that's no exaggeration).    Beware: this isn't a hip, trendy place to take that one friend that can't get past the orange booths; this is where the foodies go.

k9DaUwv9onCkPmWlqO0sng.text: This place rocks! Co-winner of the best chips and salsa in the valley. Best house Margs at $3.00 each...top that one! The Mexican pasta with wide egg noodles topped with their green chili is addictive and you won't find that one anywhere else. Its always busy and hectic but somehow they find you a table quickly. They also tend to remember you on return visits which means they don't have turnover of their help like the chain places do.  Highly recommended and would give it the coveted fifth star if they would someday do a little remodeling as it is "rustic" and then some if you get my drift.

jmPXtyAkOiC5dJVPGZeBVg.text: I love Via Delosantos. The food and service is great. The pomegranite margaritas are amazing! The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because the main dining room needs some TLC on the walls. Exposed drywall that's breaking into pieces (window seats) isn't very appetizing.

ZP_09FIkgRRzY_J3p1MjEg.text: We ate dinner here with our three kids on a Friday night. We were told the wait was 15-20 minutes, but it ended up being 45. The bathrooms and the restaurant were dirty. The food was ok. Both my wife and I ordered fajitas - one chicken and one beef. The protein on both was tough and overcooked. The corn tortillas that came with the dish were OK, but they stuck together in the wax paper roll they were served in. So when you pulled them out they had holes in them...rendering them useless other than eating them plain.  They do have a nice selection of tequilas. I had a Don Julio margarita, but it was too syrupy for my taste.

xkDKrqYDRk2VBgdoBu817A.text: I wrote a big, long review yet it did not get saved!  In summary, great place yet the food is very similar to other Mexican restaurants in the valley (Valle Luna comes to mind). Great staff and they make sure you get your fill of chips/salsa. Will come back and looks like a great place to catch a football game (American or soccer).

a_OaS_kD4nnNn6RLPNH2hQ.text: Standard Mexican fare in a questionable part of town. Small, nice decor, mature friendly wait staff. Ridiculously high prices on tequila shots and drinks. Im a Po-pos fan.  Probably won't go again do to  out-of-my-way location.

4IJD4k0hNzUv8loYBcacyA.text: I drive by this place quite often not even realizing it was here. Surprise surprise what a little gem we found! I went big on my 1st visit and I'm glad I did. Not everyone cam mask a chili relleno the way I like them. Well well well they did Definitly be back for more chips and salsa probably the best in a very long time other then my besties moms salsa Can't wait to try a happy hour out specially in the patio when its cooler. Glad I found this place and decided to stop. Service was great our server very nice and the rest of the staff as well. Thanks for a great breakfast!

RkejAbrR9-kIKnEDOO4tTg.text: Nothing to write home about.  Food is average.  Can be really spicy. Inconsistent- so hard to know what you are going to get.

oMJh9KCJPqaTg7fpG1dxsQ.text: I don't give ratings this low very often but after looking forward to the evidently over-hyped Via Delosantos I was as thoroughly disappointed as can be. Our server was kind and attentive, and the crispy cheese app was actually quite good, but that's where the praise ends. And the demerits were enough for their rating to drop from what would have been a 3 (if the food just wasn't for me) down to a 1.  The beef fajitas were not plentiful but that's okay because they were overcooked and utterly tasteless. But that wasn't the worst of it. The shrimp enchiladas were disgusting. Usually (but not exclusively) shrimp or seafood enchiladas are covered with a cream sauce. These were covered in a tomato sauce that was closer to the taste of a tomato paste however. A poor chef's choice perhaps, but also poorly implemented. But even then it got worse.  The shrimp were either of an extremely low grade or not cleaned well, or both. Each bite seemed to introduce more and more grit making the dish completely inedible. We didn't complain and paid the full bill but left most of our meal on the table and left unsatisfied, disappointed, and with absolutely no desire to ever come back.  Via Delosantos came highly recommended and hyped even more. This was reaffirmed by the high ratings. Well maybe all that comes from the experience of an earlier time, but don't believe the hype. To even call this place ordinary is giving it far too much credit. There are SO many MUCH better places in the area that even "average" should have a tough time... much less "well below average."

1RQbAEgWUbtOLN--SpNm7w.text: Okay, so this is a dive of a joint, but you will not be disappointed! They have 200 tequilas in the bar and their bartenders are always fun! It's a family owned business that serves really really good mexican food - their fundido is amazing!  The atmosphere is so so fun, we always have fun in a crowd there.  Their waitstaff is wonderful - they give you good suggestions and are really friendly.  A must visit and highly recommend!

XHOwP-tYZzgZjrj_fwvF-w.text: This is one of my absolute favorite Mexican restaurants. I don't typically have to wait for a table, and the chips and salsa are amazing. I love all the food that they offer and they even have vegan options. Great family owned restaurant

gkDxGU-Hk7XZrljkG-izAQ.text: Someone took me to lunch here about eight years ago and I had the Albondigas soup. Apparently, it was quite memorable! Overcast January day in Phoenix and I'm cuing up the Mexican soup memory. The place is just as hole-in-the-wall as ever and congrats to them! ... Celebrating 30 years on July 4th of this year.   I've never had a margarita here but they look legit. You'll be intimated to get a Dos Equis though. If the XX pinata doesn't pressure you, that guy who doesn't always drink beer but when he does is here in life size cut-out form. And on a poster. The salsa (hot) is a "must-taste" even if you don't do hot. It's got great flavor, doesn't burn your mouth but will clear your sinus. The mild is straight-away good as well.   The two chicken enchiladas with rice n beans were tasty too, though more meat wouldn't hurt (I always feel this way, really!)   Have I mentioned the Albondigas soup yet?! It's so flavorful. Two big meatballs in the medium (size) and among other veggies, carrots! Is this the only Mexican dish that contains carrots? I mean besides like home-pickled carrots n jalapeno?   Good service, good food, even if more Americanized Mexican. It's fresh and well-flavored. Haven't mentioned this part yet: reminds me of this place in Cancun - high school trip - some Mexican stranger who quickly became our tour guide & amigo took us down a narrow road and into a stucco room brimming with color and cerveza. This place reminds me of that place. Maybe not worth a drive for some, but definitely delivered for me today. Albondigas!

lWVnVCVQeKiqaMh9ghRPjQ.text: Out visiting friends in Phoenix and wanted some good tequila and Mexican food.  We sat in the bar where Mike was mixing it up and putting it down.  We had the jukebox in the bar rocking with classic 80's rock.  Everything was amazing including the warm chips and salsa that showed up as soon as we took our seats.  Tacos, fajitas, or empanadas, you can't go wrong.  It was all amazing.  Be careful the plates are hot.  Reasonably priced. We had a great time.

rAXrapkDiiyzcO9mQI1EVQ.text: it was really bad.   Walked in and smelt like sewer. Seriously I can't believe the place remains open. I am going to contact the health department.   The restaurant is in very bad condition. The whole place looks run down.  Food was Filabertos level.   Do not go here. One things for sure is people dont know real good food. Those reviews and reviewers are crazy.

t8sjcrOJDvDq6CGsuX6o-w.text: The best Sonoran Mexican food I've ever had--even in Mexico. An absolute institution. The best chips, the best salsa, delicious True Mexican cocktails.  Definitive. There's no other way to put it. Dream-worthy.

CnhI0Ui_h1sYsBCZLgftlw.text: The food was amazing. The supervisor was extremely rude. She looked like she did not want to be there. She kept looking at her phone as if she was ready to close the place down when they still had 2 hrs to close. At the end of our dinner she just dropped the bill on the table again as if it was an inconvenience for her . We paid and walked out as she starred us down not even said thank you or anything.

vFj3tzrhM40nvtKJ1caE6Q.text: Went w/ a total of 11 people, mostly adults but a few younger children, ordering a wide variety of items.   We were seated w/in ten minutes, which is pretty solid considering the size of our party.  First off, let me say the chips and salsa were excellent.  Absolutely delicious and fresh salsa, same with the chips.  I had the Mexican pizza, with half shredded beef and the other half chicken.  A+ on the shredded beef, and there was a boatload of it.  Very good chicken, although I think shredded Chx is preferable to the cut up chunks of chicken.   Still great all around, one of the better Mex pizzas I have had in years.   My wife had the Chx chimi, and she said it was even better than Macayo's, which is her, up to now, favorite.  Other people with us typically had burrito's or quesadillas.  All said the food was fresh and very good to excellent re: taste.   One person, who is accustomed to quite spicy food, said the carne asada burro was too spicy.   This surprised me, must have been quite a bit of kick to that carne asada although I cannot say for certain.   We had two pitchers of XX lager, which was cold and reasonably priced.  Slight downside to not having cold mugs, but no biggie.  Very reasonably priced in total for the size of party we had.  I will add this is a pretty small place, so that might result in lengthy waits on occasion, I can see the potential for that.  Place is a tad cramped, but that just adds to the atmosphere.  Service was prompt and courteous.  In total, I'd say 4.9 stars.   Even better than Valle Luna, my otherwise favorite.   Both my wife and I preferred Delosantos over our LT faves, which says a LOT re: our having lived in the Phx area for decades.  The only very slight gigs, to me anyway, were that shredded Chx would be preferable over the chunk, and it seems some of the items might truly be on the spicy side.  'course that's why one goes to one of the last family owned/operated Old School Mex restaurants.   Flat-out excellent, wish we lived closer.

KrAJ3vsUYYCEI_DjpnD_5Q.text: I've been coming here sense I was a baby. It is where I learned how to behave and not piss off others as a child.   This place is an awesome gem off north central in a neighborhood that has been described as the hood. The food is delicious, the decor is authentic and hasn't changed for years.   I'm a BIG salsa lover. I need my own bowl refilled through out my meal. Their salsa is one of the best I've had in Arizona.   You really can't go wrong ordering anything. The only thing I'm not a fan of if their premade margarita (because I don't like them sweet).  They don't have a website, they are old school just the way I like em.   I posted pics of the menu because- I can.   Eat up, so worth it!
