WY96BgtHfZ54iyVPx1hY9A.text: So I've been to Via Delosantos a number of time since I moved to uptown Phoenix six years ago. Finally, I'm getting around to writing a review. If you want classic Phoenix-Sonoran Mexican food and great service in Uptown, this is where to go. Service is quick and happy. Chips are thin and crisp; the salsas, regular and hot, are tasty. The menu is extensive and the food is delicious. I can't imagine something that you would want in a Mexican restaurant that isn't on their menu, including vegetarian options, egg dishes and their own unique pasta dishes. Walk into the dining room and look around. You'll see that this is the place that locals and especially Mexican-heritage families go. 'Nuff said (except note that this is for the dining room; the bar room experience can be different as in a different kind of local crowd that's not everyone's cup of te...quila.)

WmWqm9baE-sJANKEMSY_4g.text: I mean it was ok. Nothing special. The food is pretty good but there are just so many other better places. The inside is just ok too. Sorry not sorry y'all!

mNpoiQNyoTUKDQVm3o2GiQ.text: Great food, monthly client to this place. However my experience tonight was jaw dropping. Michelle the bar tender told us we could only sit here if we ordered dinner (around the bar) We ordered drinks and an appetizer. He then asked us if we're ordering dinner. Confused because we ordered food, we carried on. Michelle then demanded we move seats because this booth was his "money maker". We asked to speak to management. Patty then help us get through the hiccup. When leaving we wanted to pay through the manager on duty up front. The bar tender then followed us to make sure we were going to pay. At that point I was hoping Patty the manager would smooth things over but was disappointed how she proceeded. The bar tender called the police and Patty then told them we would not pay and to hurry. Will return to eat however would like to speak to the owner. Please help, I love this place. Owner, please call me  602-390-0253  Thanks, Garrett

Z4DoE9cNyYNN_LlpGqKvkw.text: The restaurant as advertised is filthy which is inexcusable.  Service was good and the chips and salsa were excellent. However the Pollo Fundido  which was advertised as being excellent was far from it. The sauce was skimpy and the worst part was the inside was about 3/4 of the cheapest cut of dark chicken mixed with just a little bit of white meat thrown in. The refried beans were runny and the rice was bland. Overall would not recommend coming here when there are far superior options available in Phoenix.

1tUPW1NJ3P2JrQ-G-dmaxQ.text: Great prices, excellent food, friendly staff and lots of tequilla

9KPJuzhb8x4IxYI526DamQ.text: So the salsa has way to much black pepper.. the service isn't always friendly.. but the list of tequila's is TDF! I generally frequent this place for a cheap yummy lunch, green chile Navajo taco, and is super close to work.. nothing like tying one on at lunch time to make the rest of the afternoon smooth by.. just kidding, I never do that!

ySruKIRjWulxD0zzoon2QA.text: We were in the mood for something different and hoping this would be greatness. Unfortunately, this wasn't it. The experience was "okay". The food was okay.  Neither one of us was a huge fan of the salsa or chips, ( we were hoping to get closer to the salsa my fiance's mother makes since one of the reviews says "Not white people mexican food" however according to my fiance the food we had was a mere okay, and didn't live up to that.  The service was a bit slow on drinks and we barely saw our waitress. It was terribly busy so that may have accounted for the service...although the food was out ridiculously quick!  It wasn't anything I got really hyped about, not being big drinkers I don't think we fit the primary people that this place appeals to (those who love tequila).  So if you're into drinking, this may be an amazing stop for you with its huge list of tequila, if not, you can probably find better food elsewhere with about the same prices. By the way, if you're going around dinner time...you're probably going to have a little trouble finding parking because they are packed!

c3V_eslSNYp1bG_N3ce7NQ.text: This is totally the coyote ugly* of Mexican restaurants.   *Not the movie or the bar, you ass. I'm talking about the phenomenon. If you figure this out, you can figure out why I give it 3 heated and questionable stars. But, yeah, what everyone else has said, basically.

u9OicZs8RPEZbZzinKGHuQ.text: Quite possibly the best authentic Sonoran Mexican food in Arizona, no wait anywhere!!  This place seems like a total dump, but trust me the food is awesome!   Try their cheese crisps, chili relleno (anyone who likes this dish knows it pretty much sucks most places), Shrimp fajita burrito pollo fundito style... Some of their chicken dishes are not great, as I am not a huge fan of shredded chicken. Opt for the fajita meat instead.  Try hitting this place during dinner time on the weekend, and you will understand why all the locals to sunny slope don't tell anyone about this place. Unfortunately the wait during peak hours sucks, but worth the wait! Parking can suck so just park in the neighborhood behind the restaurant. Also, *some* of the servers are not great, but again, the food is worth it.

GOkBvdK7Ds-SRRsOjziH-Q.text: 3.5 stars  Funky little Mexican cafe. Food was in generous portions. Atmosphere was just what you'd expect from a family-owned place, colorful and busy.  The tamales were very very good. Margaritas were fantastic. Our entrees were pretty solid. I would have liked a bit more spice to mind but overall I was pleased. For the price it was  a good dinner.  Service was a little slow and spacey. I'd say it's a decent stop to make.

uXw1rLB5aa0bMbzFue3aNQ.text: Mmmmm ... tasty. My friend and I split a giant entree for maybe $15, two frozen margaritas at $3 each, and I had a draft beer for $3.5. The meal for two was $40 with a generous tip. The ginormous tamales were especially memorable. It was what I expect Phoenix to be. And the cuisine is different from Mexican in Dallas or Albuquerque. Nice fresh salsas.

3u5XGJzoo172i3YPIedJwg.text: A toss up between here and El Bravo, both about the same distance from Point A. (my house).  Delosantos wins because of the real margarita's.  My favorite entree item is the red beef burro, some of the best in town.  Excellent tequila selection.  What most Americans would consider "authentic" Mexican (Sonoran) food.  It is kinda ratty, and any restaurant that has been around this long might have trouble keeping their health dep't rating.  Edit:  After another year (and 5+ trips back), I have to give it another star, and amend my comment about the cleanliness of the restaurant.  First, the red beef chili burro is _still_ one of the best in town, I've been using that as my barometer for other Mexican restaurants, and this place still wins.  Also, they've cleaned up the dining area quite a bit, so I take back the 'ratty' comment.  Lot less dusty then I remember it, and maybe a fresh coat of paint, who knows.   Still, the prices are good, and the food is great.  What's not to love?

fDe2U0cEhlyQSXakemV36Q.text: I went here last week. This place seemed okay, I have never heard of it before, but my friend suggested it and really liked it before. So, we went there, and the staff was really nice but everyone was quite 'blah'.  Not too happy to be working or something? (Who really is, right?!). So not too many smiles coming your way if you go here. Anyway, the salsa/chips that they bring to the table were pretty good. They have hot and mild on the table and I didn't know which was which (usually I can tell), but found out right away! If you like hot salsa, then you'd like the one on the table!  But def. good flavors.   For dinner, I ordered the fish tacos (Tacos de carnitas is what the item was on the menu) . And the flavors were quite good and good portions I must say. However, the fish was overcooked so it was a little rubbery.   **Just a note, they do have a Vegetarian menu which I found very interesting at a Mexican restaurant. So there is food for everyone!  Overall I had a good experience here, the prices are a bit high to me, but that was really the only downfall. (And that I wish some of the staff would of been more personable.) But no matter, the company I was with,  was entertainment enough! :o)

kxcwFa_QQeVnGwiOHYYaEA.text: We used to love this place.  99c ritas, good food, good atmosphere.....  My family had been going there for years...  But... over the past 3 years or so the service has gone down hill fast!  On our final visit to Via's we met our waitress when she took our order and.. then never saw her again.  I had to get us more forks, ask for more Chips and Salsa, go to the bar for more drinks ect..  Then we the bill came there was a 20% gratuity added!!!  We asked if we could have the 20% taken off so we could tip what we thought the service deserved.... that's when we saw the waitress for the second time of the night... She said that she could not change the ticket since there were 6 or more people on the check...  At this point we were very upset and took our check to the front to pay and never come back.  As we were paying and complaining to the manager the waitress takes cash out of the drawer and hands it out to us and says  "just keep the tip if you didn't like my service" in a rude attitude way.    We told the manager to keep the tip since we would never be back to their establishment again.  Our family is very easy to please and we understand that restaurants get busy and service can not be 100% all the time.  But we do expect basic courtesy even if its the busiest night of the year.  I do miss the old Via's

QB9lZ3cfcaStsi0sQ1hlRQ.text: I went here for the first time ever last week.....  And I loved the food!  Delicious.  I shall return.

xPZj37x-kUyFa7ve9cXa5Q.text: This is good Mexican food.   I wouldn't say it's THE best but it ceratainly is good.     The chips are pretty much what you'd expect (thin and crispy).  The salsa is very good and will make you keep dipping buckets of chips.   I had a Carne Asada buritto.   I liked it.  It tasted good (spicy, good meat, good texture, etc.).  The tortillas are good as well.   I say good a lot because I wasn't blown away by the taste.    One of my friend also had a carne asada burito and agreed with my assessment.  My other friend had the carne asada fajita plate and really liked it.  They have an EXCELLENT tequila selection.   You will not be disappointed.   There were equal compliments about the margaritas.    The ambiance is authentic mexican.   It is a family owned establishment with a long history in town.  It definately feels this way when you are in the restaurant.   Overall, this is an "A-OK' place to eat and drink.  You'll enjoy it.

u2PYR7tsx9aN0bAu6pC1vw.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. Period. Nothing compares to their delicious cheese-crisp, fresh tortilla chips and yummy salsa. Oh, and their machaca beef enchiladas with a little extra cheese will have you turning your car around by the time you reach Bethany Home and uncontrollably driving back for round two.*   Their service can be a little rough around the edges at times, but in the end it really doesn't matter. You didn't go to this place to bitch and moan about service; you went here to eat the best dinner you've had all week.   My only last piece of advice... eat a lot early on in the game, their dessert leaves a lot to be desired. They could get some legit honey for the sopapillas (vs. Kraft packets), and the fried ice cream is so-so.

tPaNWO5MpGrlyVBuJurc1w.text: The best corn and cabbage enchiladas (with white sauce) in the World; been coming here for twenty years.

V94pY-ghremCkkCLHjPrEA.text: Via Delosantos is one of the few places in Phoenix that a vegetarian can get a good Mexican meal.  Neither the beans or rice are cooked in lard, which is hard to find in this town.  The chips and salsa are premium, just watch out for the fried potatoes and such - very greasy.  Thanks to Philip's illuminating review, I hadn't heard about their health code violations.  It's something I'll keep an eye on in the future though... if they take another dive like they did in 2004 I'll keep my distance for a while.

_f1SpEIHZ0EzEsXNOB0GLA.text: Great food and friendly staff.   The chips and salsa were very good. So were the chicken chimichangas. Great prices too!

1WiMBBwA4gD7r4rq8RMRZQ.text: One Liner: Good for lots of margaritas and food  Food: (scale of 0-4) 2.2 You get a lot of food for very little damage. The salsa is awesome. The hot salsa taste a bit more chemical and it isn't really hotter either. Whatever you order, you get plenty of food. This is a great place for getting full while getting some margaritas.   Extras: (Scale of 0-1)  0.7  Service 0.2:   Decor 0.1:   Speed 0.1:   Dessert 0.1:   Prices 0.2:   My score for this experience is 2.9 stars.

OpQfpk6NX1v3LDJWhBNgXA.text: Does anyone else think chips and salsa are part of the foodgroups? I do! Yes this is a hole in the wall, yes it is in a scetchyer "hood"  but it will be worth your time.  Margarita's...check out their 2.99 deals or just for the heck of it get a piture and share with some friends.  The atmosphere can be loud (decor and patrons alike), but for this reason, it is a good place to bring kids because no one cares when your kids are as loud as your adults. On to the food....Chimis are great, my husband always gets the heart attack style (this is not the name) chimi with white cheese sauce. There are a lot of vegitarian options here for all you non carnivores. If you are looking for good mexican food and mostly chips and salsa that should be part of the food pyramid, then Via Delosantos is your place.

Y6hcbZCaQVFP_1E8cXqGaQ.text: I have 2 words for you: Fundido Sauce. That's all you need to know. Go forth and conquer.

JQjCEf542J9bvtCGt0E9bw.text: TERRIBLE !  WILL NEVER GO BACK ... A dirty hole-in-the-wall ... $3 margs ... Good deal right ?  Yeah if you like the taste of dishwater and ass... According to the bartender, 3 ingredients in their house mix are water, OJ and sprite ... And from the taste of it, the water came from tje toilet ... Don't get sick ... Order top shelf ... The food is bland and greasy.  The service is rude, terrible ... Dont ruin your evening going here ... There are plenty of places to get good food and service like American Taco or many others.  But if you like abuse, terrible service, and sickening margs, by all means go here !!   I will never go back. Oh one of the salsas was good (Chipoltle flavor).

rPvhLhLjK0Z1XtucC7jkjQ.text: Best Mexican I have found in phoenix.   I have been here many times and have yet to try something that I haven't loved yet.  This place is a bit of a hole in the wall but to me that is what makes it even better.  Great cheap margaritas and excellent chips, salsa, beans and rice.  Every time I have been the service has been fast and really good.

_rDXzJNkxHnDgMTIHzJjrw.text: Parking lot always full. Great Yelp Reviews. WOW! Great food. Friendly service. Authentic charm. I'll be back often.

EnWRKVD0okSfBXGg1H4yTw.text: I don't get it. I really, really don't.  People swear by this place.  I know people that have gone here for years, and for that reason I gave it my three strikes chance.  If a place has potential, or great reviews I will generally give it three tries to see if I had just missed something previously before I will take it out of my rotation of restaurants.  Well dear Via Delosantos, you're out!  This place is a hole in the wall, so you expect it to be a lil quirky,  but I always left feeling like it was more towards dark and dingy. The service was never anything to impress on my visits, on my last visit it took around 8 minutes for our server to show up in the first place and I was considering walking out all together.  The food here is mediocre.  Definitely nice sized portions, and there are a couple winners to choose from, but with a menu this large it is expected that there will also be some losers as well.  They pride themselves on their margaritas, and maybe I am just used to stronger pours elsewhere, but I found them to be pretty weak.  Basically, I find this place to be lackluster.  I am all about supporting the mom and pop, but there are plenty of other local Mexican restaurants to choose from, so all these people that swear by this place can keep it, I'll go elsewhere.

PGHNCKyPDUpdjo5o0YOoNg.text: Back here in Phoenix again, and our first stop for dinner is always Via Delosantos. Love, love, love this place.  It's nothing super-special, just good food, good service, excellent prices.   We always sit in the bar - love the vibe in there. It's casual, and definitely a "local" spot, but you never feel out of place. Free chips and salsa and the two salsas are delish.  Only weird thing was this time, I wanted two different kinds of chili rellenos... one cheese and one shredded beef, with a side of rice and beans.... they brought me TWO COMPLETE dinners..... each plate with rice & beans. Odd.  Stopped back a couple days later for a margarita at the bar after an evening out, and the bartender and all the patrons were fun and friendly and you can't beat the $2.99 margaritas.   It's always busy - that says it all.

KvP5M3tekNZ-yPTRcbYLZw.text: food is off the hook!! I had 2 tacos with a spicey carne sada dish, rice an beans, My lady had the Chimi with rice an beans... The only thing is the service sucks, kinda rude ppl. I.found a Louie V purse in or booth, I turned it in Asap, I only hope they did the right thing.

h7vqnQ5QEQU1-ivF7viMwA.text: I think you can tell a lot about Mexican restaurant from they're enchiladas sauce.  And the beef enchiladas were delightful!  The sauce has a little hint of heat, that makes you come back for more.  You can't go wrong with over 150 different types of tequila!  Wish it was closer to my place.   If you ever in the area def have to stop by

j7KgWxRU25qAm4NQrKZxRg.text: I had the Pollo Fundido which was awesome.  Chips and salsa were good as well, and the waitress brought us hotter salsa upon request.   Service was fast, prices are reasonable.  The Fundido was $9.95, with beans/rice was $12.95.  It looks like a small hole in the wall place, but it's right in the heart of Phoenix and fits in with the area. We will be back!

iUDdBhii8Bbj1u9hYPCmeQ.text: Best in town I've been going here for 10 years...  pollo fundido death row meal ...

EQ6alowY3dnAfLDWlhBBwQ.text: Not much to add to my review from July. I had the same dinner, the same drink.  LOVE it...LOVE it.   Keep the margs and warm tortilla chips coming!

534LvaFH9SyccQtpGnRbIA.text: I will have to go there four times this week to achieve my goal as duke of delasantos (hiccup)

sp7X75RBcdRtbLCNqM4X7A.text: This is one of the best old-school Mexican restaurants. Everything about the place is outstanding. Great sauce, cheese, beans, rice, salsa, enchiladas, tacos and the huge selection of Tequila. This is a legend of a Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.

Eyw8e2g01dvHWntu0Eag5w.text: I've been bringing friends to this neighborhood find for years and only today learned it's not Via de los Santos! It's named after the owner, Delosantos.   I went to Sunnyslope High School, so this is my old 'hood.   If you like a place that's cozy and funky with nice staff and tasty Mexican food, go here! I asked our server whether she recommended the chicken or the shrimp fajitas, since I love veggies and chicken or fish. She recommended the shrimp. ($11.95)  Wow! I ate the whole plate...which should have been enough to have a small plate for leftovers. But no-oh! It was too addicting to not devour it fresh off the grill. Whatever they spread on the shrimp? I was in heaven.  The chips are decent. The chunky salsa was tasty. When I asked for a spicy bloody merry with a garden, they did put in two olives (no celery) and the server came back to ask if it was spicy enough. Nice, right?  It was yummy.   They have $3 house margaritas all day, every day. And 200 tequilas, which I can't report on because tequila gives me a hangover before I go to bed. And I hate hangovers. Just like you.  It's located just north of Dunlap on Central, on the west side. If you can't park in the lot, park on the side street.  Enjoy!

TDDTttsZ38r7oEiIqmanXg.text: I have lived in Phoenix for some 40 years and was not aware of this place until just a short while ago. I have been 4 times in the last three months and have had something new each time, there is nothing i have ordered that i would not order again and it is mighty good chow.  The staff is quite wonderful so I will recommend this place to any and all.  William F.

EutEysA_NcjPibEgn4w7mA.text: My fiance's favorite meal of our vacation. This was recommended to us by the front desk staff at our resort and turned out to be less than a 5 minute drive away. The chips are a little thinner than we are used to but the salsa made up for it and then some! Definitely worth check out if in the area.

BW41X_mtioGX2IfMdkQZ1w.text: Although I don't think this is the best Mexican in town, they are close. I crave the spinach and asparagus enchiladas with the white sauce. That is for sure the best enchilada in town!

qNxXEP6mEyDKHADhM3I3gw.text: I was a little uneasy coming here just based on the area around however I quickly found that for real authentic mexican food, not a whole lot can compare.  What I love about this place is that it is True mexican food.  Places like Macayos and Garcias may be good but they try to slop so much chile and baja sauce on everything that it really loses out on the real flavor.   However, Delosantos is delicious.  I always get the Via Chalupas which is some sort of marinated beef (carne asada) soft tacos.  They are massive and comes with 3 per order with rice and beans.  They are mouthwatering.  I never have to add salsa or sour cream to them and have never been disappointed with those.  Most of my family loves to get some form of the tacos, enchiladas, and tostadas.  Just depends on what they want mroe of that night I guess.  And the cheese crisps may be simple but they are cooked great everytime.  I don't drink however others in my family will dine on pitchers of margaritas there and they absolutely love them.  I myself hate tequila so no thanks but to each their own.   The chips and salsa are staples but the hotter of the 2 salsas has the best flavor in my opinion.  The regular has too much cilantro in it for my liking and I could do without it.    I had tried the chimichanga initially going there and it ws good but nothing too special.  But overall this place has solid mexican food, a friendly staff, and although it might be small and you may have a few minutes to wait, it is well worth it.    I'm giving it 3.5 stars because I haven't tried the entire menu and I am very particular when it comes to Mexican food.  But from what I have tried, well done!

vmqOvFghmT2U7vm_pHLJag.text: Our first visit to Via was about five years ago shortly after we moved into the "Slope" aka Sunnyslope.  Back then the waiters were surly, the food was good, and the 99 cent margaritas would knock you on your tukus.  About the only thing that's changed in that time is the margaritas are now $2.99, but you'll still get the same great food and the same surly service.  Well, that's not entirely True of the service.  It's been my experience that if it's a slow night and you have a female server, then your service will be top notch.  If it's busy or you happen to get a male server, then it can get a little frustrating.  I personally think they have the best mild salsa in town.  I always fill up on chips and salsa then feel like someone needs to roll me out the door because I'm so full after dinner.  The portion sizes are huge, so you can't go wrong there.  My favorite dish is the #3 combination, Green Chili Con Carne with rice and beans.  My only complaint is the same with every other Mexican Food restaurant in town, is the lettuce they use as a garnish on the plate.  I've said it before and I'll say it again...Heck I might even climb up "S" mountain and scream it from there..."COLD LETTUCE HAS NO PLACE ON A HOT PLATE OF MEXICAN FOOD!"  There, I feel much better now.  But seriously, you don't eat the lettuce, at least I don't, and even when I accidently do, it's hot and soggy.  Who likes that?  But I digress.  The bar is small, and always crowded.  The patio is nice if the weather is good.  Their list of tequilas is almost two pages long on their menu.  So if you're a tequila aficionado, then you should check it out.  If I had to rate Via on food alone, I'd give it four and a half stars.  If I had to rate via on service alone I'd have to give it two and a half stars only because it's spotty approximately half of the time.  So if I average them together Via would get three and half stars, but I'm going to round it up to four because the last few times, the service has been better and I really like the place.

53DUYGxXKaNWZR4LV0fU8g.text: Two colleagues and I visited this place for lunch today.  Only a so-so experience.  I have been to Via de many, many times having grown up in the Sunnyslope area.  They have consistently had good food and great margaritas.  But today's experience will make it tough to recommend.  We were seated promptly and had waters and chips and salsa soon thereafter.  We took some time to look at the menu and decided on 2 MaryLou's with red sauce and a green corn tamale.  They were all lunch specials that came with our choice of rice and beans.  The food arrived within about 10 minutes and everybody enjoyed their meal.    My major gripe about this place was the service.  Once our meals were delivered we didn't see a server again.  I had to stop a staff member who was passing by to get some water refills (we were all down to less than 1/2" inch of water in our already small glasses).  No one came by to check and see if we were enjoying our meals or if we needed anything else to complete the meal.  When we were ready to leave, we had to go up to the front to get our bill and a to go box.  Via de is a place where you pay at the register but I still expect the bill to at least be dropped off.  They didn't appear to be exceptionally busy and I saw customers at two other tables looking around for someone to assist them.  Bad, bad service.  I don't know that I would head back when there are plenty of great Mexican food places in town with much better service.

7NudBVxW8SvQYBxlIp-gJQ.text: It is just North of Dunlap and Central on the West hand side.  But, it was a nice mexican restaraunt with very YUMMY chicken enchiladas for great prices. Lately I haven't been liking the red sauce that comes on enchiladas, but this red sauce was killer!! And served with the traditional rice and beans. I love when you get those great big plates for nothing of a price, and the free appetizer of chips and salsa (they gave two different salsas!). Also, they had house margaritas, small one was only $1.99, not even on happy hour!! they weren't holden back on the tequila either! Service was very nice. Highly recommend for some good cheap margaritas and food with flava!!

NOM-MKuzkehGYQga62R5lA.text: I have a bottomless stomach for good Mexican food and this place can serve it really well. It doesn't matter if you're a light weight like me or a fast eater, I'm sure you'll find yourself licking the plate clean. The beans were especially delicious and the chips and salsa were far better than somewhere like Chili's.  The servers were polite and attentive but not pushy, and it didn't feel awkward. There were a few flies by the window seats and that hurts the atmosphere of the restaurant, but it didn't really bother me much.

zoiVGdx2a-vPWXU5HQVbLA.text: I would have never visited this place if I wasn't meeting a friend here. Not because it doesn't look appealing, but because I never knew they existed. I'm glad that my friend suggested this place because it was a pleasant experience!  The restaurant was medium sized; not too big, but not too crowded either. The staff was friendly, quick, and helpful. Their menu had many delicious items including a pretty good lunch menu. However, I ended up getting a dish from the dinner section of the menu.   They provide chips and two different salsas. One had small chunks of veggies in it and the other did not. The one that did not have chunks: wow, so good! I think I ate much more chips because of this salsa. The chips were nothing out of the ordinary. Just your regular Mexican restaurant chips.   I think this place broke the record of how fast you can get your food. Literally, they put fast food joints on notice with the speed. It was literally 5 minutes (or less) from the time we ordered to the time we were faced with our dishes. They were piping hot, the plates were very hot. The food was fresh, and delicious. The plating was very organized and clean. I would have thought that everything would be messy because they rushed in getting the food to us. But it was neat and tidy.   Food was great. The service was good. The restaurant was satisfactory. One thing that bugged me was that there were 4 or 5 flies that kept bugging us. It was like we were eating at a picnic. Otherwise, it was good overall. Give it a try.

Dy1-zqoBfaHZYCxxaZOLUQ.text: Good food. Good salsa too. Service was ok. She seemed like she was in a hurry though.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FjC26PhrFjks0n38OkWT5Q.text: This place is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Arizona. My only complaint is - why didn't we find you sooner?? Not only do they serve delicious authentic Mexican food, they also have an impressively long tequila menu (They can boast a selection of more than 100 different tequilas! ). My son had just eaten ice cream before we arrived, so he was not planning to eat much. He loved his Supreme Quesadilla with shredded beef so much that he quickly devoured it...without letting me have a bite to taste. The vegetarian section of their menu is pretty extensive, so my husband was super happy; he practically licked the plate clean of his zucchini & corn enchilada with white sauce. Friendly service. Oh, and their Mexican rice is THE best I have ever had at any restaurant - so flavorful, homemade style!!

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

540Al_9ux9Nq8WDMwcjiww.text: Only giving 4 stars cause the man didn't let me drink a margarita cause I forgot my wallet even thought I had been here a few times.. DESPITE that, this place is very tasty. Their margaritas are great! Me & my bf get the pitchers every time we come here. They're huge pitchers & so worth it. Their food is always delicious I haven't been let down yet (fingers crossed) I would recommend!

dPeqky5ohiTOKuU2F5fxVg.text: This is indeed once of the classic Phoenix Mexican restaurants. I've been here dozens of times, and love bringing out-of-towners. The menu is vast!   We like the veggie section of the menu. They do not use lard, so I usually get a vegan bean burrito (no cheese). The tortilla is excellent! My husband likes the spinach enchilada. The chips are fresh and warm, and the salsas are above average.   The interior of the restaurant is perfect on a scorcher of a Phoenix afternoon. It's almost cave-like, especially if you are in a booth. The service has always been prompt and friendly.    While I appreciate the veggie section of the menu, maybe next time they print it they could mark what items are vegan, or could be made vegan? Other than that, this place is great!

MaofgYQI6U0kEh-D2_tX-g.text: A friend introduced me to this spot a few months ago. I loved the Red Chile and margaritas. I have been back a few times to try other dishes. Red Chile is the best. Last night visit was bad. The service, the food and my margarita. I am sick this AM.

n6a8fnVz4ETOvZ7kHUELJg.text: I LOVE the food here!  Have eaten here many many times and it's always good! Their enchilada sauce, green and red, salsa mild and hot is delicious. This is what I have had on the menu.... Beef enchilada red      Enchiladas (all kinds)  Gr Chile Burro.             Shrimp Cheese Crisp  Gr Chile Cheese Crisp Tostadas.                      Fajitas.                           Via Delisantos pasta     Hot and regular salsa   Sopapillas                      House Margs (3for flavor, 5for price)  I eat there A LOT!  Prob my favorite Mexican in the valley I have tasted this far. Im always eating in the bar area but the service is great and the atmosphere is friendly. Love this place!

5vnW6ckC1TqeJm74P05GVg.text: I have been patronizing Via D since they opened in the mid-eighties.  The food has been consistently great, and the decor and atmosphere, which was pretty scarce when they opened, has improved vastly over time.  This is a friendly, laid-back, noisy, neighborhood joint, with a large and varied menu and affordable food and drink.  They are popular, so sometimes the place is packed, and the speed of service sometimes reflects this, but the service is always good and friendly.  This is where I take friends from out-of-town, and it's almost always a big hit.

V-81zPDkLoMOc-kHQ2_Ajg.text: I flew in from San Francisco to visit a dear friend. But my first stop was Via Delosantos. IMHO , it's the best Mexican food  I'm going to fly back to PHX just to have the Red Tamale's !!

AGivH-rjc-kwH3WSn3V3fg.text: Went here tonight with my husband for the first time. We were seated after waiting under 10 minutes. Everyone was really friendly and the food was great! My husband had enchiladas and I had a green corn tamale with green sauce and an enchilada with red sauce. Everything was perfect. Highly recommend this place!

LaQnUJhSx-pqxHs14dyJHQ.text: Simply Amazing Place to come and enjoy your evening  with friends and family.. The service was awesome.. Food on point ..

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So love this place .. The food is Amazing .. The Drinks are off the rocker .. If you haven&#39;t been here come over

V6TQtCtQfImF4W9vMIel7A.text: Man I haven't been here in Forever at least 10 years back then the food was not very good service sucked but they didn't have the best margaritas and I really cheap price 4 things have changed food has gotten a lot better not the greatest but still pretty damn good prices are good I had the tostadas which the tortillas are nice and crispy not soggy and you get a lot of places I liked the beans and it was loaded full of cheese and vegetables it was great chips and salsa or average service really good on top of things and fast and she had quite a few tables taken care of I was very impressed with her and guess what the Margaritas are so great at least the house when is plus they have like a hundred different types of tequila I think definitely start going back here

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tostada

ngg7lK8oRbO0fGlQZxzYng.text: Typically good, maybe due for a dining room redesign or rearrangement of the layout.  Also, maybe some spicier options would be good.  Headed there tonight!

DgP8BQ9uiwC7k3nonFdz2g.text: I would like to say that I've tried lots of things on the menu- but truth is that I tried the pollo fundido and that's all I get now. It's delicious! The beans are better than other places I've tried. Everything that my boyfriend has had is awesome (I try bites of his). The chips and salsa are good. Overall it feels like a nice mom and pop location with food that is different enough from other joints like it, to make it stand out. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do! It's worth going out of the way for.

sAl-tr1EXB5hUXNnZm96dg.text: I have eaten here many times.. the food has always been good.. but the service sucks.. without going into details, there needs to be some kind of training.

pHLLy5bgO4lJKTODOJ0jtQ.text: Ordered take out here last night. Food was great and the service was just as good. I think I met the owner when I picked up my order she was super friendly.

umOu6Yz2nRPN2JcuXO2c1w.text: Love this place, locally owned. Been around over 20 years. The food is amazing, you will love their specials.  I do not drink, but their margaritas are perfect,parking is small, you will have to park on street. The servers and hostess are great

VS8u56s1lr-wU4kZeBZ8Ww.text: Was in the area last night and check what time they closed, Yelp and other sites said 9:30PM. We walked in a 8:50PM and as the hostess started to seat us, another hostess came up and told us they close in 6 minutes, no other comment, just silence.    I asked if we could get served, no comment. So we left and went down the road to Ladera.  Ladera was very glad to have us. I really do like the food at Via De Los Santos and the margaritas, well you can't beat them for the price (get the hand mixed ones, well worth the extra $1)  But the treatment by the second hostess was unusual and off putting.  Thus a 2 star rating. My suggestion for the readers - Don't trust the on-line open/close times. My suggestion for the restaurant - If you are open until a given time, then happily serve your customers until that time, oh and be sure the information posted on line is accurate.

oa7wihKEA0ndY69NQWeWgA.text: So I went to dinner there for the first time ever and I ordered a chili relleno one bite everyone knows the rules and I gave it an 8.3 thinking about it and talking to the waitress I decided that I told her I would give it 9.2 because she was awesome. Very impressed highly recommend this restaurant. Overall rating is a 4.7 but I will give it five star rating

3O7uV6CaohGzU8BAyJwEWg.text: This is one of our go-to Mexican places. They have a surprisingly extensive menu with a lot of vegetarian options and of course the classics. Their chips and salsa are muy delicioso and their margaritas are yummy. The servers are always consistently great. The only thing I don't like is their guacamole...it's creamy almost like a dip and not my guac style.

ZfayJ8U71vcWHNe9gLPHmQ.text: Great food great service excellent Tequila selection.  Check out the red Chimichanga

KzlchXtSSFTKQZMch_LNTw.text: Perfect family run local Mexican food joint with some of the finest tequila in town.  At least the variety is fine.  The flautas are great and the service good.  Busy on weekends

TMpeHsuOWfl-vRkuSNRLJw.text: Met up with some of my favorite folks last night because I NEEDED some cheese enchiladas paired with a margarita or two.  This little place has great service and really nice servers and wait staff...it was an enjoyable evening from start to finish.  The food is good ol' sonoran-style and I changed up my regular order to include green chile .  Yum Yum Yum!!!!  I like the fact that there are vegetarian options and the prices are really reasonable.  One of my friends has been eating there weekly for several years now so that's a pretty high recommendation.  I'm finding out that they have other regulars as well.  Still looking for the perfect red sauce but this place is OK in my book.

kDEeSqPdSIbvmr9cf1BIgA.text: Jimmy is my favorite bartender. This is where you come to find out what is going on in the neighborhood. The beans r the best in Phoenix!!!

I-_3wraojpzN_mQqV6q3GQ.text: My wife and I love this place! It's the kind of Mexican food you can eat once a week, it's great every time! We always ask for Katrina as our server, she is always friendly and attentive. It's definitely a little "hole in the wall" but seems to be very clean. Great food, great service, we love it!!

3Kab8xdDwHr1tK5Tvcv8QA.text: My Favorite Mexican place! LOVE the Margaritas!!! Me and my husband frequent this place often. Amazing Queso dip and Steak burritos!

PrBHTijdxB2okd0ku-_bHw.text: Incredible tequila selection! The food is consistantly very very good. Service is always attentive. Both the mild and hot salsa are two of my favorites but I'd suggest asking for some of the freshly made pico de gallo.  This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Phoenix.  The shredded beef tacos are very good but the machaca are even better.

QSiksOfqBLlSwKlo6ilZGQ.text: We are staying at Tapatio Cliffs and I will write my review on that place next, which believe me won't be good. As far as this restaurant, AWESOME food!! My mom ate at the restaurant 12 years ago and remembered it tasting amazing. She was right!  The restaurant had a lot of locals/ regulars than the typical travelers, like ourselves. The servers knew a lot of the people by first name, so that's pretty cool. My 12 year old nephew ate every last bite of his 3 taco carne asada plate! He said it was the best Mexican food ever. My 5 year old son had the open faced quesadilla and ate more than half (which is a lot for him), my step daughter ate every bite of her bean and cheese burrito. I had the veggie fajitas and there was so much food! Plenty for two people to share!! The veggies were fresh with carrots, onions, asparagus, green beans, potatoes... Such a mixture but believe me it was good! I'm not a meat eater so it was delicious for my liking. My mom got a fish dish that was delicious, cooked perfect with great flavor and not fishy tasting at all. The staff was friendly and welcoming even after my son spilled an entire water all over our table ( we actually had to move tables). We didn't go to the restaurant for decor, we went strictly for the food. So if that bothers some yelpers that's their opinion. Small and dated would be the only negative but I would still give this place a two thumbs up.

rGHjXYF2cUxVgA1lQ07sWA.text: Love this place! I can't find authentic Mexican food like this anywhere else. Everything on their menu is great and their chips and salsa are THE best.

sHOXeEM9Jz21ZLZmsZQJfg.text: What a fun restaurant offering great Mexican food in a casual atmosphere, and at Great prices. This is not a trendy chain restaurant, but a local favorite.This is the home of the 99cent Margherita.   They have good chips and homemade salsa. Their food is fresh and well prepared. They offer a full bar in this fun and friendly restaurant. The decor is interesting and fun...we have enjoyed this place for many years.

yRU0jfShR8aqmIo8qaYcBw.text: My wife and I love this place.  Food is outstanding and the margaritas are solid, with everything being a fairly reasonable price.  Only things keeping it from being 5-stars is that the service can be hit or miss depending on who your server is and the seats (particularly the booths) aren't all that comfortable.  Really like the outdoor seating as well but it would be better if they had something else going besides cheap plastic patio chairs.

N76hswcwN1IIsb2SBstTig.text: Went here for dinner last night with a few ladies and was surprised by the diverse selection the menu provided.   However, being that I was adventureous in even trying a new place,  I settled on chicken enchiladas for dinner with their white queso. I questioned going to this place altogether due to it's unfamiliar location, and while initially questioning my sanity/safety, i have determined their food is DEFINITELY worth dying for :)  One of the ladies i was with raved about their food prior to us arriving, so my expectations were set pretty high. She also mentioned they had good margaritas, and to my pleasant surprise she was right! And, um...hello $2.99!! Their chips were good, their salsa was lacking flavor/spice (IMO), but their white queso was phenom! Perfect amount of flavor and spice. And yes, notice i said WHITE queso. Saw someone else mention they only use yellow cheese. Last i checked, i wasn't color blind. Forgive me, I digress.  The other ladies ordered a bowl of the green chili, and a burro. Didn't try the burro, but it looked/smelled great and the green chili was also a success. To finish things off, we had their fried ice cream with half honey & half strawberry. WOW! First time i've had it, and i'll definitely be going back if only for their $2.99 margaritas and fried ice cream. It really is the small things in life that make us women happy :)  The staff was entertaining, attentive, and polite. My only complaint about my whole experience was that on the menu the enchilada I ordered indicated shredded chicken, and it wasn't. It was chunked/cubed, and in turn made it very "chickeny" (it was STUFFED with Chicken) In addition, it was ALL dark meat. I prefer white meat over anything, but I suppose "to each their own". I think i'll just try a beef or cheese lada next time.  All in all, very good experience, and at the top of my list for best Mexican in the valley!

_D_eWSUbxTAmlorst1LB3w.text: If you don't want to read the whole review, I'll sum it up in one sentence -- Via Delosantos only uses yellow cheese.  I went here about 4 years ago for a celebratory occasion, and was afraid to eat the food based on the smell of old grease and the look of the entrees on tables around. We ate on the patio, which is directly on Central Avenue, and after the horrid smell of grease & exhaust pipes, I couldn't wait to flee the scene.  Last year, I was unknowingly led back to this same place.  Years had passed, and I had completely forgotten about my vow to never return. This time, I was pleased.  It probably helps that upon entering my expectations were very low. I immediately was attracted to the kitschy Mexican artwork, their vast tequila collection on display, and of course, the christmas lights.  The salsa seemed fresh and was just the right amount of spice. They keep the chips & salsa flowing so be careful not to fill up.  The margaritas are really sweet, but they're cheap and will get the job done.  This is the kind of place where you stick to basics. Don't get fancy or try and order something healthy.  Get a chimichanga, burrito,  shrimp enchiladas, or a chile relleno, and if it's appropriate, get that sucker enchilada style. Be sure to have your Tums handy when done if you think you can eat a whole plate by yourself.  The portions are huge and totally splitable.  Oh, last word of advice, don't get the guacamole. It's super gringo, and has a ton of sour cream in it.  I'm giving this place 3 stars b/c it's a good value if you're sharing, they ambiance is very comfortable & amusing, and the service is very accommodating.

GHUBWo913UhhTtsnm26I7w.text: When it comes to finding an extensive selection of 100% Agave tequila, in Sunnyslope, look no further.

LEj5k0mI-ZHPWdNKBQsBpw.text: I've been going to this place for years.  I love the fact that they serve grilled veggies and a wide variety of them.  I also enjoy their inexpensive margaritas, enjoy their chips and salsa, and the laid back atmosphere.  This is a True hole in the wall, but this establishment's food and margaritas are the treasure in that hole!

mr0D0BSZ3r4izJdBPmMjCw.text: Came here on a recommendation...did not disappoint. Great atmosphere, food is excellent and their salsa is on point. Definitely some of the best Mexican I've had in the Valley.

xnAk6OqQ5EQtHybRRTieTA.text: Great reviews, big disappointment.  Cute place, I felt like I was in Mexico. Good chips. okay salsas. Food . . . chile relleno was a salt trap, green corn tamale was not exciting, my friend's pasta dish was entirely bland and kind of a goulash without sauce.  I did something I've not done in 20+ years here in Phx: I left more than half my meal on the table.  When I rejected a to-go box, the hostess/server didn't bat an eye . . . Service, nothing special.  Too bad.  My friend and I love Mexican food (not Americanized, either) but we'll cross this one off our list.

kW318kMlv62npa4DW5s7rw.text: I love this place, the bar is really small but it's totally cool.  This is what I call a local neighborhood restaurant/bar.  Great food and I just tried the Carna Picada for the first time and it's my new favorite dish.  If you like jalepenos and carna asada (or pork) you can't go wrong with this dish.  Make sure you try one of the house margaritas, they are $2.99 all day, every day.  Salsa is really good and so are the chips.  This is an old school Phoenix Mexican restaurant, you can't go wrong.  I am docking it 1 star because I think the carna asada could be trimmed better, I have had some fatty pieces before in my meals.  This is something easy to fix, they just need to pay closer attention to the details.

GplIjskZ5jYGrS8KPNG--A.text: Part of me really wants this place to have 3.5 stars...damn Yelp!   Anyhow, my rating is as follows:  Location: 2 stars, though something is oddly mysterious about this place.  Service: 2 stars, ALWAYS have bad service.  Food: 5 stars!!!  Yea!!!  I discovered this place when a good friend of mine took me here.  He said you will love it...I did...well, the food at least.  This restaurant is located in the Slopes, so come locked and loaded.  98% of the time this place is PACKED and their parking lot is super small, which means crappy parking in general.  I have had issues with this and have had to park in the neighborhood or in the establishment across the street.  The facility itself is rather small too, which is maybe why it always seems busy.  Upon entering I have found that it takes a while to be greeted.  The wait staff runs around frantically, although it only seems like I have ever seen only the 3 same servers each time I go.  The bar is located to your right and is small (sorry happy hour goers), and there are two separate seating areas, with seating outside.  For the tequila lovers, you have A LOT to work with!!!  Their selection is huge.  I often just close my eyes and point, and there is my shot for the evening.  They also have cheap margaritas too if that is your thing, with your basic beers on draft and bottle.  The ambiance is filled with old decor, but adds to the theme of the place, making it cozy in some aspect.  There is a large variety of food to select from on the menu.  I usually have the carnitas or carne asada.  ALWAYS delicious, never questionable.  I LOVE their chips and salsa.  To me, a good Mexican food restaurant in my book MUST have good chips and salsa to be considered worthy of return.  I just don't eff around with this.  They have this covered!  The only thing I can really complain about in this case is the service.  It always seems like it takes forever to be greeted, forever to have the wait staff take our drink order, then forever to return with them, then another eon to take our food order, and another eon for refills, and even longer for the check and processing.  Why is this?  Can someone please explain it to me?  If you are on a time crunch, this is NOT the place to go.  So, with that in mind, I leave you with the humbling message to try it out!  If you can tolerate their lack of prompt service and risky neighborhood, than you are a okay and ready for take off.  Bring a group of friends, have some shots, eat some good food.

fec350k8A6HuaDteXdFD4w.text: Had been 5 years since I've been here! Wasn't even on yelp then.  Friday night. Place is packed. Found a spot in the bar. Margaritas delivered promptly. Chips and salsa as well. Not that great. Chips were cold and salsa in tiny little bowls. Just blah.  Ordered bean dip it was very good.  Also chicken enchiladas and a beef dish with hot peppers.  Both very good. It's a kitschy place.  Margaritas were only $3.50. Decent. No booze in then. But cheap enough.  I'll return. It's a fun loud atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mural
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar area

rRPpjkHnTkoN2YVn3Cyrgg.text: Saturday night. 6ish. Not very busy inside but the parking lot was jammed. Sat immediately. Chips and salsa along with waters brought quickly.   Chips greasy and hot. Mild salsa had great flavor with a slight kick. Hot salsa was just that. Hot but good.   Order a shredded beef chimi, kid's enchilada plate, #12 combo. (Taco, enchilada, rice and beans) ordered the bean and cheese dip appetizer to start. Don't bother with this one. It's just refried beans in a dish. Good beans but not really a dip. We added salsa and it was much better.  Food arrives. Everything looked good but instead of the kid's enchilada they brought 2 mini tacos. We didn't want to wait so my son said he'd eat them. I'd have thought we'd get a small discount for the mistake but nah. He ate them so no foul.   Husband's combo was average run of the mill mexican. Nothing wrong. Nothing special. My chimi was soggy but the tortilla mised with the guac and sour cream was good. Shredded beef tasted like something I'd cook in the crock on a long day.  Overall was a decent meal and a good value if you're looking for large portions. Just average though. Building is in dire need of a remodel. Missing tiles and chips in tables.  If in the area I would dine again but not go out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shredded beef chimi
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wwpEd3txTgtnt1g_uu3g5A.text: This place is the reason I can never move from Arizona. Mexican food in its purest form.   1. Food it's all good no matter what you order you will leave full and happy.   2. Service from the moment you walk in greeted with a smile and menu. Which everything on it is delicious.   3. Atmosphere I don't talk about that much but I love the feel of this restaurant.   Via Delosantos thank you for being good in everything you do.   Your place makes this hungry Hawaiian happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonoran chili cheese fries
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese Chrisp with green chili

VE04lBF7AKdPeeRvdWn11g.text: Established in 1986, Via Delosantos is a local favorite. Located in the Sunnyslope area, it is our go to Mexican food restaurant. They have cheap margaritas, free chips and salsa, and good food for a reasonable price. They also have a ton of vegetarian options and all of your favorite Mexican food options. Try out the cantina section of the restaurant for more of a lounge feel or sit down with the family in the restaurant side. Everyone is very friendly but the service does tend to be on the slower side. If you're looking for an authentic style Mexican restaurant in the Sunnyslope neighborhood, Via is your place!

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NzkRZMV2x6Qu2w2LQ1AORw.text: We have been going here for years and love the beef tacos, beans, chips, and salsas. The sampler platter, cheese enchiladas, and desserts are also very good.  Check out their Monday-Friday lunch specials.

UkqVcNbYH6X9s--8iHzkVg.text: We walk in, guy opens the door for us, walks us to our table, and takes our drink order, pitcher of beer on the table in under two minutes.  Great service, and oh yeah the food is great too.

bf3zNhuohi0jKaUZ9bTAYw.text: Via Delosantos is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. We've been coming for years. The staff is always very friendly. Within minutes of sitting at the table, you are served chips, salsa and a glass of water. If you are a margarita drinker, or even if you're not, you have to have one here. I've never been disappointed! They are tasty and have the perfect amount of alcohol. Two is my limit lol. Throughout the years we have tried multiple items on the menu and have enjoyed all of it. My kids and I all love the red enchilada sauce. It's flavorful and has the right amount of spice to it. This is a place I will continue to refer people to when they want good Mexican food!

DMcSITd2WEl7cpzdeli5uw.text: The best place for Mexican food in the Sunnyslope area. They have been here a long time and we'll be there here for a long time. We enjoy going here all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shredded beef chimichanga shredded beef chimichanga
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My wife enjoying the veiw

IznpM1S7QghE7hMk49MzmQ.text: Great atmosphere and service.  Food was very good.  Didn't have to wait a long time to be seated or service.  The Spanish Steak was amazing. Chips and Salsa kept coming.

AamQ5WAbQARTabCrC9MybA.text: For the last 13 months I've been driving for Lyft. Bringing people from all over the Phoenix area to this "Hidden Gem". I wondered why they pass up a Trillion Mexican Restaurants. Now I know. The service is quick. The food.... Well just check out my plate. Green Chili Tamales, Rice & Beans. House Margarita. Hidden in the Foot Hills of Phoenix are other Mexican Restaurants. But... This is it.....

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YO29N2Wb_TPStGPAriQlDw.text: Location; Dunlap just south of central. Older in wear and tear dining and bar area separated. Oddly when walking in the bar area felt cool in air temperature but when we sat in the dining area air temperature was definitely more warm wish we would have sat in bar area.   We came in for lunch, and have mixed reviews on dishes!  Food; I got the shredded beef Chalupa and it was delicious- the masa was cooked to perfection and meat was yummy.  My daughter got the Pollo Fundido she couldn't eat it - now beware it does not come with white chicken so feel if it was the meat cut she liked it looks like it may have been delicious.   Service; super friendly and apologized for daughter not able to eat her dish - we didn't ask but she removed the dish from our bill.    I'd try it again soon to update review.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shredded Beef Chalupa

Y0HG8pCqaVKUImDWxk0WYA.text: It's one of my all time favorites when it comes to Mexican food in the valley. Their meets where it be beef, pork and or chicken are flavorful and moist. The bar has many different kinds of Tequila. They gave me good advice on trying different ones and now I have a favorite. The staff are friendly and know the menu. The fired ice cream is my favorite desert from here with honey. I have tried many of the meals and will continue trying more.

rpgkWoykfvqwFFQKGzZ_PA.text: I've now been here a couple of times because it's close by to my current 'hood. It's just decent food. Not over-the-top amazing, but if you want some basic Mexican fare, that's not fancy, this is a good choice. When you want a cold margarita but don't want to spend a fortune, come here. When you want super-friendly service, this is the joint! I like how they make their own taco shells instead of pre-made. My friend always gets the chimi. Salsas are pretty bland, but I love their chips. I'll keep coming back for the laid-back atmosphere and friendly people who work here and deliver cold margs for $3.50 a glass!

yKvFVq6mRyR1FSplWGyLiQ.text: Have been here s few times. Had dinner with our son on Saturday, and we must of missed the early dinner crowd as we were seated right away.  This restaurant has a big variety of choices on their menu. All of us ordered our favorite burrito. Some restaurants even though their burrito meat is chunky, they have a tendency to be kind of tough. Not here, the meat is nice and tender. My better half ordered her favorite the green chili burrow, our son ordered his favorite as well. Today I stuck with the red chili con carne burrito with a side of beans. Sometimes, one just feels like having something simple.  Via Delosantos has been in business since 1986.  If you ever have a hankering for tamales this is the place to have a good tamale meal.  When you come into the restaurant there is patio seating and on a nice day could be just to your liking. Their bar has a huge variety of tequilas if that is your thing.  It's not that big of a place but, it can handle a lot of customers.  While we were there a bunch of employees put on some big sombreros and made a lot of noise and sang happy birthday to one of their customers, which I thought was nice to do that. When I say they made a lot noise, the whole restaurant knew what was going to happen.  They are located north of Dunlap Avenue and Central Avenue. Give them a try if you happen to be in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The sign tells you when the restaurant started

thoLDHAJNDjAhla3dnjCmg.text: Amazing! Amazing! I have been searching for a Mexican Restaurant like this since I moved to Phoenix. Everything is freshly made, and not frozen food reheated. I can't say enough good things about this place it is truly a hidden gem. Their tamales are made fresh that day, and you can taste the love. I have had their enchiladas, and can promise you you will not be disappointed. I absolutely love their salsa, and their cheese dip pairs very well with it. This is my new go-to place for delicious mexican food.

ZzUI5_EOEWbjJ39jjyQcfw.text: Absolute best food ever , I have not had anything I haven't loved . Chips and salsa amazes balls  I recommend the OMG burro chimi style toped with jalapeno cream a cheese  .   Ground beef crunchy tacos  are soooo good

NB1ttcUsva5Ac_LjjARlXQ.text: Took my mother, who is confined to a wheelchair, here a couple weeks ago. Been here many times and she really enjoys the food. It was busy so we waited. Pretty soon there were 4 groups behind us waiting as well.  After 10 minutes a table opened up and the waitress began to take us. Then the hostess told her to stop. Since we had a wheelchair we couldn't sit in that area and would have to wait for another table. So they gave it to the couple that came in after us. And did the same with the next table that opened. We left after that. The food is good - well, it was before - but if they can't follow basic ADA accommodations we'll never go back. There's no shortage of good Mexican food in Phoenix.

1oJPax02caFQ3xOFjbCimQ.text: Yum! When we arrived on a Friday night it was packed! We got some margaritas and sat on the porch until there was a table available. Our waitress was very kind and speedy. Everyone got a meal that was delicious! Head on down to this great Mexican food restaurant and enjoy some complimentary chips and salsa while you wait for your meal. We'll be back!

7iPHE1VZC74l-EmQ09yKNw.text: Yes. Yes. Finally!   Finally found a place with legit Green Chili!  The sauces were on point.  The ghost pepper salsa with the Red Cheese Enchilada is amazing!  Also how can you even be mad at the small pitcher sizes of drinks??  The service was impeccable, the foot on point.  We sat in the dining room this time but want to poke around to the bar next time!  It looked fun!

FPSuHGTQcuG5z1aXDl41mQ.text: Went for dinner. Didn't have to wait and the place was pretty quiet. Sat outside on a nice covered patio. The service was really slow - took about 15 minutes to get a drink and about just as long for them to come back after it was empty. Food was good and everything was fairly price. Quicker service would move this rating to a 4.
