Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tY0WQvDeBmiJWTI6aZJd1Q.text: I've been to Via about three times now, and I have had nothing but a great experience! The quaIity of the ChiIe ReIIeno bIows the chain Mexican food restaurants out of the water! The portion to price ratio is fantastic. They offer fresh, thin, corn tortiIIa chips with IittIe bowIs of yummy hot sauce and miId saIsa. I wish those bowIs were deeper, because my husband and I are at the bottom before you can say crazy quesadiIIa ten times fast.  The house margaritas are aIways $2.99 and made with decent tequiIa. Not to mention they make the mix fresh each morning, and it's deIivered POOF! right after it's ordered.  The onIy thing I think couId bring Via up to five stars, wouId be the decor( it's Iike sensory overIoad waIking in there at first), but, it's charming in its own right. :)  I wouId definiteIy recommend this to anyone who Ioves a reIiabIe, authentic, Mexican meaI from time to time( or in my case, every other day).

skASXqZkVKsm68Z1Cc-35A.text: Bottom line, Sonoran style Mexican.  The first thing to contend with here is the old school menu. Too many items I have had too many times. I have a tequila and a beer, chip and salsa. The tequila list is long and looks good. My pour is heavy but I didn't like my choice I went cheap. Had a double cross lager, a good beer. The salsas were great.  I decide to try the spinach, asparagus enchilada, rice and beans. Now I'm very happy  that my ingredients are very good. I enjoyed the meal. Ate it all. I would love to see many more recipes from other parts of Mexico, especially tacos.  It's a new year, out with the old in with the new.

vMCe8iEwB3KZD-nuKJMILQ.text: Love this place, it has become one of our go to restaurants for Mexican food. They have a huge tequila list but the $3 house margaritas are better than most and for that price I stick to those. Their chili verde is excellent, the tacos, enchiladas, beans, salsa, are all very good and the chili relleno is one of the best I have ever had. So hard to find really good ones!!  The only thing I have had that was so-so and I won't order here again (better elsewhere) is the albondigas soup. Also they give 20% all food orders to seniors on Thursdays. Wahoo!!

SDbOmdrMbE5CWoAbBm7ZxQ.text: Far and away my favorite Mexican restaurant in AZ.  Food is always fast and great, carne asada is spot on and everything is delicious.  Always leave full, happy, and when off the clock with a little buzz on.  Great place to bike to as it is close to the canal path through central Phoenix.  Good for Breakfast lunch and dinner.  I don't live close but it is worth the drive.   Cool patio when the weather is nice.  Middle of Sunnyslope just south of Hatcher, if that is too much of an issue for you well than thank you for leaving a seat open.

OLhx52gQc5vumznK1pOVMg.text: I needed a margarita... yes, needed.  I needed it immediately and I needed it icy cold.  Closest watering hole was a mile away.... and it was open.  Via DeLosantos has a list of tequilas that is 2 pages long... you can get a terrific margarita and a good dinner for 2 for under $30.    After our emergency first aid kit of frozen margaritas and margaritas on the rocks, we relaxed our way through 2 bowls of salsa, chips and guacamole... then came the tacos and chili rellenos....  The atmosphere is a little of Rocky Point meets garage-Quonset hut shabby Mexican craft chic.  It is ultra casual, but in my opinion, NOT seedy.  It's colorful, and loud, and comfortable with liberal use of paint.  It was the perfect way to wind down after a long day.... I think I'll have one more.  Did i mention that the house Margaritas are $.99.  Good too

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. tacos at via delosantos

UN3z6VUSdgLdGZROcx8V4Q.text: Can not say enough good about this place.  I love it.  I love it!  I simply love it!  We have always had really great service and the food!  Well, the chips are thin and salty yumness and I love the salsa.  They keep you filled up and aren't like other places which try to ignore an empty container!  Number 16 Combo is my guilty pleasure!  I have had it many times the way it's intended:  Chicken enchiladas with red sauce...but lately I've been getting it with Fundito sauce and I've gotta tell you:  I'm hooked!  Try it........it's a little more $$$ but SO worth it!  I haven't had desert since I'm gluten free but the size of the fried ice cream is Gigantic.  My daughter swears by it!  Man, I wish they were open right now...cravings have begun anew....

fXcDtE4GoOz_rZ-zF-nhuQ.text: This place USED to be one of my favorites but sadly the food has gotten worse over the last few months. Don't know if it's new ownership or a new cook but I went back again just to verify my results and had the same results. There are much better Mexican food places in area so sadly I'd try them instead.

a3bddMZPiqqqy67f-H7Kmw.text: Very casual setting.  Close to divvy.  Friendly service.  Tomato sauce based salsa.  Not really authentic.  Too tomatoey.  Chicken quesadillas and mini tacos were good but nothing special.

t5UPbZEnJLVWN6PA3B0qXg.text: Remarkable!  I had the huevos rancheros and the underlying tortilla was soft and fresh. Two salsas, of course, both with clear tomato flavors present. The coffee has what I thought was a touch of Mexican chocolate but it turns out was a hint of cinnamon added. Delicious!  The beans were light colored and flavorful as was the rice.  I am a vegetarian and the options on the menu were extensive for folks like me.  If we come back to Phoenix we will definitely, definitely eat here again.

BSpSynw4WYbEWbVXYqAWCw.text: I was brought here by a local who had never been here, but was told this place had great, authentic food. Unfortunately, the majority of the menu consists of the same old Americanized-Mexican food that you will find at most Mexican places. There are a couple of standouts - the salsa verde chili Colorado was pretty good. The bowl of chili app was pretty good as well. Tequila selection is extensive. Overall, nothing really to rave about. A solid meal, at a decent price. Service was fast and friendly. I'd visit again.

UlvesKR28Q0Nek0WoyBvrA.text: I read about this place in a guide for Arizona and really wanted to check it since it is an authentic mexican restaurant. On our way to the airport from the Grand Canyon we briefly stopped here to pick up lunch. Since we didnt have time we ordered two take away burittos which we ate in the plane. This food even 3 hours later was DELICIOUS. i really want to go back to Phoenix just for this. The service was excellent too. Highly recommended restaurant.

MfhoORWIjAe35V2eGfmu7A.text: Best Mexican food that I have enjoyed in a long time. Chips and salsa are fresh. Margaritas are strong, delicious, and 3$! The plates are filling and flavorful, the specialties are always a winner. Service is great, but I also don't expect servers to kiss my  bum. Feels like your in Mexico, without the drug lords, food is always good when I come! Mmmm good, that's all I can say.

g_BEMb38nAoNvjRaAb0PNg.text: So. Fabulouso! I'm cereal. From the chips and salsa to the green chile cheese crisp to the endless parade of margaritas and shots of tequila right down to my bean tostada, out of this world tamale and cheesey cheese ensheelotta....  Well...  If it were legal to marry a restaurant, I would seriously consider courting Via Delosantos. But it's not. Can't marry a goat. Can't marry a gay. Can't marry a restaurant.   We had attentive and friendly service and was informed because it was 9:30 it was last call. So we ordered up! Went with my besties who are regulars so I feel as though we were extra pampered.   Extremely generous tequila list. Comfortable and cozy decor. Clean restrooms. Great company and delicious food.  As Arnold says "I'll be backito!"

MGOYZVdVfxBjGcja8Iztzw.text: As a newbie to Mexican food this is a nice transition from taco bell.  The rice and beans are savory and the enchiladas are guaranteed to lull you to sleep soon afterwards.  Fresh salsa,  cheap drinks.  Friendly  and colorful environment.  They were  patient as I inquired about the variety and my general ignorance and misprouncation of the food.   I shall return!

TBxEQOjw7MnbuifhEoc4eQ.text: Good foot, cheap prices on Alcohol and food!  Definitely recommend this place!

GgfzJbfgwyBWeEgL3bYPQg.text: I saw the reviews on Yelp and also was recommended by a local.  I'm from New York and there aren't a lot of great Mexican places there, so I was excited to get my hands on some authentic tacos.  My boyfriend and I ordered 6 chicken tacos.  While we waited for our order, we munched on some chips and salsa.  One of the salsas was tasty and had the right amount of spice.  The other tasted like the sauce from a Lunchables pizza.  We both agreed and joked about the taste but it didn't really bother us.  Here is where the two stars comes in:  We get our tacos and they are hard shell.  I really dislike hard shell tacos so I asked the waiter for an order of soft shell and offered to pay for my original order (I felt bad).  When the new tacos arrived, I was greatly disappointed.  The cheese looked like Kraft and both the lettuce and tomato looked like the cheapest produce one can buy at the grocery.  The worse part was the chicken.  The chicken was boiled and flavorless.  I forced myself to eat at least one.  My boyfriend felt the same way about his tacos.  The people there are really nice and sweet  but the food is really not good.  Maybe other things on the menu are better but after that experience, my boyfriend and I will not be coming back on our next trip to Arizona.  Fifty dollars down the drain :(

nRNByDlKz6_XkA61QF0N9A.text: Holy cow what a great hole in the wall. We read the reviews and needed a pollo fundido fix since we had not been in Phoenix for a few years. It was a 25 minute drive but totally worth it. She had the pollo fundido and i had Via Mexico. Both great. The special extra hot salsa isnt really hot but has this smokey grilled  chile goodness that we couldnt place but want to duplicate. 3 margaritas on the rocks were $8.97. We are Austin foodies so we have no shortage of good tex mex but this place is special and a do over for us. Oh yes...fantastic service.

0hzGS0Aw0pTkNrwhiQc3ig.text: Food was good, staff was nice.  Margarita was mediocre.  This off the beaten path little place was great for my out of town group.  I would suggest the shredded beef chimichanga.  It was pretty good!

T8d2H8hnyERm0HiAoJTMPA.text: Haven't had anything I don't like here. The carne asada taco has been a go-to for me. But it seems like one of those places you keep trying new things and keep liking them. Definite to return!

GhqEr1HBZo93imoVjD9qCA.text: I love this place.  It reminds me of my trips to Nogales as a kid with family.  The plates are always hot, the food flavorful and the staff consistently friendly and attentive.  Great chips and salsa and they keep them coming.  The only recommendation I have is to double check your bill.  My uncle mentioned that he regularly gets overcharged here so we started paying attention to our receipt.  Sure enough, the last three times we have been here we were charged more that we should have.

w9eHS3cZSt51wnVyniI8vA.text: Been going here with my family for the past dozen years. Great place. Friendly service, good margaritas, and great chimichangas and pollo fundido.

irQdgtC0j4rVRGG5Fa7mgg.text: Seriously been going to this place since I was a child! AMAZING FOOD! Service is great and everything on the menu is so tasty!!! When I go I usually go on a Sunday. I'm a super fan of their menudo and I had it today at lunch!!! Our waitress was kind and anticipated our needs! I would absolutely recommend trying the fried ice cream! I always get it without the chocolate. Not a fan of the sauce so I just get it with the whipped cream and I'm never disappointed! Also def recommend their tacos carne Asada in particular so yummy!

tyQwmAq8wdgpo0MBHUCHZw.text: I have been here numerous times & it has always been a nice experience. I went in the other nite by myself & the bartender told me to grab a seat so I chose a booth. It was @ shift change so he grabbed me a drink & then Mike (the new bartender) came on. There was an older man wasted @ the bar who was going on re how he'd been there drinking nonstop since 1030am ( it was now 6ish). He was yelling all kinds of profanities & talking about getting weed & getting high then says that he needs his keys so he can drive home. I said to Mike that he should order the man an Uber & he snarkly replies," he's not my problem!" & walks away from me. Fast forward a few moments & the old man fell backwards off his barstool & slammed his head on the step & was OUT!!!  Ppl jumped up & literally Mike stepped right over him & carried on..... like it was no big deal!!! He never once acted like he cared. Fd comes & after they left, Mike came over completely cleared my table & gave me my check!!! I said is there a problem? He said, you need to go, I need that table..... now mind you in my 45+ years, I've NEVER had that happen!!! I said I didn't realize I was done. Then he says, you can sit w them ( referring to the couple in the booth next to mine WHO I DID NOT KNOW!!!) The whole thing was so bizarre!!! Then he tells the 2 guys who were sitting @ the high top next to my booth that they could have my booth!!! My head was spinning!!! I was seriously confused!!! Again, never had that experience before.

iZkY-7BOQDUIGy0dJbykoA.text: IMHO,  Mexican food is an entire food group on it's own.  The best is here.  Agreed the chips and salsa are a staple in themselves. The Chimi's, Tacos, Enchiladas, all are great.  They are a long established business of 30 years.   Personally I just don't bother going anywhere else.

izU04TAblE16b2Mzm4aBoQ.text: Solid 4 stars, the food is almost 5 stars. The decor and dish ware are lacking but it's a hole in the wall what do you expect?? First visit was two weeks ago and I took the family back twice since. It's definitely worth checking out...oh yeah, $3 house Margaritas and $4 small pitchers of beer-----good times

g7XJ-bUZuRlwYPIeIflA3Q.text: Very good, very affordable Mexican food.  The employees of the restaurant were very welcoming and friendly.  I went with Roman's Street Tacos, which is three carne asada street tacos with hot sauce, steak, onion, and cilantro.  They provide optional lime and lettuce on the plate as well.  The tacos were very tasty.  The meat was generously portioned and flavorful.  I saw a number of other dishes come out of the kitchen and everything looked good.

r3IXDUmLIG21xppwQM9FFQ.text: After my second time eating at this establishment I was once again disappointed and will not be returning. You can get better Mexican food at the food truck in the Charlie's parking lot.

hRiVS4xszEzHzJkrmpUZXA.text: Green chile burrito is the best. Via De Los Santos has the best chips and hot sauce in town. I am no fan of cilantro so I do not eat the salsa, but my family loves the salsa.

KX3aIVJjJaLTTAOkQL5nYw.text: Oh no!  Me thinks not.  Food is bland and lacks creativity.  Service is also not attentive either.  I received a soda refill with a hole in the glass which I discovered a stream forming on the table.  The waitress didn't understand leaking glass so I had to explain HOLE in glass.  I received another soda but the stream was still alive and well.  She did not come back to soak up the spill.   Our plates were surfing Baja style.  Ten minutes later,  gut bomb has been set off.  They may have an extensive menu, but I would pass even on the table of contents.

Ae1A55tKu5lfB5DrgaZHRg.text: Loved the chile relleno! Large portions. Fast service. Excellent prices. We will be back.

2onFWsfmzr9pU68SeeqHVQ.text: Good hole in the wall mexican food.  The shredded beef taco was solid, but they put it on top of my beans, which makes it soggy.  Good margaritas too.  The cheese enchilada was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 people for lunch,  pretty affordable!

D1SKBtzuREHe3aShtx2s6Q.text: Went here for the 1st time with a group of friends. Neat place with a good ambiance vibe. Outdoor seating available as well as take out. Service was excellent and food was very good. Overall great experience. Parking could be better.

gNaZ7yb-jyuBFRLhHK2W5g.text: What can I say about this place, aside from that I wish there was a location in my neighborhood! A friend and I came here after receiving recommendation from the hotel we were staying at and I'm so glad they did.  The service was great - our meals arrived in hardly no time at all. And they were DELICIOUS. The margaritas were great, and STRONG.  Our waiter was the sweetest, and checked on us regularly to make sure our waters and margaritas were full. It seemed family owned/run, so I'm not surprised by the level of attention, but it was still a great surprise.

UNy6I5dy7MNdZHqJdhvy8Q.text: Was there recently catching up with a good friend. Small, family owned non-chain place. Good food. They have a lot of vegetarian items on the menu for those who are vegetarian. Great staff.

-NRJyFVQZg1qXAFxpBk2Ug.text: Really...filthy dirty place...cant imagine what the kitchen looks  like..went for happy hour on taco tuesday with a friend was told by bar tender no happy hour food at booths you must order entree, happy hour only at the bar..which is filled with old time regulars who probably tip less than 2%...why let them stay all day and they look like they match the interior... filthy vents..holes in the walls..stains of food on the walls...never will i visit this filthy dirty resuraunt .....

DnMwikg_xj8MhXxX0DmzEw.text: I live around the corner from this restaurant. This is your old school Mexican joint. Not fancy, been here for years and a great Tequila alter.

sSzJp2SGmB1qGHYKNuMRKw.text: The best tacos I have ever had anywhere. They deep fat fry the taco shell with the shredded beef in it so it's all cooked up together. Then the lettuce, tomato, & cheese on it are perfect.  Order the tacos!  The rest is really good. Everything 4 or 5 stars.  The beer selection sucks. They have a good choice of Mexican beer but no American microbrews. The margaritas are a 4.  Did I mention the tacos?

CjBZLufHVAQeh1xjqyscJA.text: I've been enjoying Vias since I was a little girl, 25+ years. Of all the Mexican Restaurants in the valley that I've tried,  It's my favorite. Great food, prices, and service!

fuAxf3VhVqZCGFfXUL2GxQ.text: My family and I come to this place often. You must order a cheese crisp. They are to die for! The portions are massive if you get the combo dinners. I would suggest maybe sharing one with someone since they are so big. Unless you want leftovers which is not a bad thing! If I could say one negative thing about the place, the seats definitely need to be reupholstered or something because they are looking (and feeling rough) but that won't stop us from being back!

EBZgmq57lRYlOBj1bu0SPw.text: Tried one more time. Better than last, but still not up to where it was in the past. So sad.

BRIq0euQTnh0mQwC_km_eA.text: Good food but extremely slow service.  Went in with a large group and everyone said their meal was good, but it took more than 30 minutes to get the check even after the plates were cleared.  I'd recommend this place as long as you aren't trying to squeeze in a quick lunch.

D3u6q4I9GfWJb776_8V8dg.text: Huge menu, gluten free friendly, vegetarian friendly, best chips, nice and thin. They have salsa and hot sauce, both have great flavor. Huge selection of top choice tequilas.  Great service, fast and very pleasant.  Eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

plw7QhKe4v8rgsMwmljwyQ.text: Food is good really enjoy their hot salsa. Sure could do without the heavy perfume one of the waitresses was wearing. The smell competed with the taste of the food. Also gave me a head ache.

iGl55y4-s00PeiiQtY6omA.text: Our favorite neighborhood Mexican! Margaritas for days! Love the pollo fundido and really anything on the menu. Service is always fast and friendly. Won't go anywhere else.

a4RDreaFJPcQcRc4slUkJw.text: Ate there yesterday and today 8/14 and 15/2018.  First day, day food was nice and hot, plate to hot to touch....  However, the waiter, left much to be desired... I saw him to take my order, the rest of the time, the bus person or the hostess helped me.Never once did he come to the table and ask how the food was, by the way, the hostess brought me my food, the bus person my drink, chips and salsa.  Mind you, I was the second person in, when they first opened, no business to get side tracked.  Never say the waiter again till he brought the check.  Second day, got there about 12:30...  had a few tables going, one woman working the dining room.  Same bus person, brought me my drink, chips and hot sauce and salsa.  Waitress walked by me multiple times, never acknowledging I was there. About 10 min in, a couple of older women came in, she greeted them and chatted like they were friends, she sat them in the booth next to mine.  Still no acknowledgement. She helped several other tables, again walking by me as if I was not there. Finally she came to the two women and took their order, then she finally came to me and took mine. I commented, I was beginning to think I was invisible, all she said was sorry.  About 3 min later she brought my food ( now, I go there for the good food, getting it has never been fast, always been on the slow side), was surprised, she placed it in front of me, no words and walked away.  Plate was cold, rice was cold and burro was just warm... Typically, I always have to blow on the food before eating or wait for it to cool down some... Not this time.  I had finished my glass of tea and the bowl of hot sauce and placed both on the edge of the table.  She walked by multiple times and never offered a refill.... All the while, she was, what seemed, overly attentive to the two ladies.  Finally, I was almost finished and after she had refilled the two ladies glasses, asked me if I needed more Tea. I said, yes, she filled, I thanked her, she turned and walked away. No words.  Then came the bill,  she just appeared out of no where, laid it on the table and walked away. No asking how the food was, if I wanted anything else, desert or such.... She did however, ask the ladies multiple times how they were doing. . So, I finished the last couple of bites, got up and went to the register.  The regular older white haired woman, who I see most of the time I go there, was there.  She rang me up, gave me the receipt to sign and add a tip if so willing.   I wrote down 0 on the tip line and when she went to take the receipt, I said, I did not leave a tip, she said yes, I see that, thank you... I asked her if she wanted to know why, She did not say a word, simply turned her back on me, literally.  So I said WOW rather loudly and left. I have never had worse service or been treated as if I was an inconvenience to serve. Love the food, so am left with the dilemma of going back simply for the food and have crappy service, or going someplace else where they appreciate their paying customers and the food is equally as good... There are several places with as good if not better food,  Rito's on 14th St and Roosevelt, Rosita's Place on McDowell and about 22nd or 23rd St,  Comedor D'Guadalahara on South Central and i-17, Sylvia's El Capitol on Van Buren  St ... Irma's Kitchen on 15th Ave and Roosevelt...  all serve food as good or better and great customer service.   I simply go to where ever I am closest to when I have time for lunch...

chvp9QIVU4N63MIaLn33Zw.text: I'm seriously confused by all the positive reviews. My husband's co-worker said this place was good. We've driven by many times and it's always crowded so we gave it a try last night.  The interior is nothing to write home about. Maybe the divey look is what they are going for so I won't knock it. Surprisingly, they have a decent vegetarian menu. I ordered the veggie fajitas, no rice and no beans. I'm used to the fajita being served in a mini skillet that's sizzling hot with goodness......NOPE. What I received was a hot plate with diced vegetables, a side of corn tortillas and a side of guac & sour cream. The veggie mixture consisted primarily of tomatoes and carrots. Where are the bell peppers??? The veggies were not marinated or seasoned so I relied heavily on the salsa to punch up the flavor. My husband got the carne asada plate which came with rice & beans and tons of cheese melted on top. He too relied heavily on the salsa. I will say that the wait staff was friendly.  If you want Americanized Mexican food then go here. If you want an extensive tequila selection then go here. I don't care for either therefore I will not be back.

uPaflY_Htie7evtkFbgUZg.text: I absolutely love this restaurant a friend brought me in and I never knew this place was there I've been there 5 times in the last 2 weeks yes I have a problem! Joanie at the front is truly amazing and the servers are on top of their game. The food is so amazing and addicting.  I can't wait to try one of their famous margaritas!!

qA6jHUVhc14sBfbWAqAfbQ.text: Been going here for over 20 years! I was born at the hospital next door lol  Best salsa and huge tequila menu. You cannot go wrong with anything you order. I wouldn't expect super classy. Its a neighborhood restraunt and has always been that way.

wMEWaYrlE9MtwEPmFd32PQ.text: Had dinner there last night. Good authentic Mexican food. Very affordable and the service was really good. The place is old but charming like a real authentic Mexican restaurant.

dYZXA0vtEaY0yvfsO_3nOg.text: Great atmosphere, great friendly staff, and really good food! Love sitting in the bar area, where you can get any kind of beverage you wish for, chips , salsa, food, all at very reasonable pricing. I would have like a little more heat to the green chili, but it was tasty.

r_rkr0TssAdgK0XQZMXL0g.text: This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant in the whole world! Their food is authentic, good quality as well as delicious!  They have very good customer service. The servers are friendly, attentive and consistent.  Their margaritas are amazing for drinks. Everything that they offer is good. I've never tried something here that I didn't like.  It's amazing food for an inexpensive price. It's a place that will leave your taste buds happy.

tnV1Ca3dFPTxDMNpyGRFIQ.text: Best Mexican food in Phoenix, everything was perfect. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

ra0G_ZuRuUTyW64QZcapjA.text: This is a great place to enjoy "Taco Tuesday". They have cheap amazing tacos and their house margaritas are delicious. I normally would have something negative to say about a business, although that is not the case here.   You can definitely expect me here more frequently.

photos.caption: Photo of Via Delosantos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very decorative.

Sv3FKbb4gRUhXcXy3PBYYA.text: I don't think we've been in the restaurant but once(I'm sure the food is the same) but most Sundays (after church Mom!) You'll find my little love and I in the cozy cantina(on the right as ya walk in) if ya go say hi to Rick, he's our favorite barkeep and there's not a drink he can't make better that it's original recipe.. and please don't go Sundays between 1130 and 100pm because the FREE green chili, red chile,and beans w/cheese is for us, they keep.telling us to share with other.customers but we don't want too. Don't forget to tip what ya would have spent for lunch cause if your lucky ya might get a shot of one of 50+ tequilas avail there. I suggest the almond and chase with marishino cherry. Damn that's good food and good people.......no where else I'd rather spend my money and a little time. Cheers.

LzWGKnJDwV8Jisbdw1wYEQ.text: My uncle and my other uncle took me here for like a birthday slash lunch thing, and it's a great Mexican food place I recommend it to anyone if you're around this area. And it's really really good it so I think it's a hole in the wall if you can find it go there it's awesome place I recommended God bless.

koYFpfiFeWGU0jo_jLavqA.text: This is our local hole in the wall Mexican place. All the locals go here and are repeat customers. Sit in the bar is possible. First start with the house margarita on the rocks. It's the best in town, not overly sweet like other places.  The chips and homemade salsa are very good and we always finish 1 if not 2 orders. The polo fundido is excellent, as well as the 2 tacos with rice and beans. This place is not for everyone ( Scottsdale attitude will not enjoy). We take all our family here every time they come to visit and it never disappoints.

gnosjPjA_rGXoURa6GWBvA.text: I adore this place. I've been here several times. Here are my tips. The margaritas are pretty good. They are just mix, but they are cheap. XX Amber is on tap, which is great. As far as eats, I love: the beef tacos, enchiladas of any kind (their sauce is great), and the pollo fundido. BUT! My two go to dishes are the the beef machacha (sp?) with eggs and red chili beef tamales. Both are amazing. The tamales are heaven. Creamy in texture, beef falling apart, and super moist. I like them with enchilada sauce too. They don't need it, but it is YUMMY. Lastly, it's a kitchy gringo place but still fun. A great spot in Sunnyslope.

GiIX9baR6olsPikZPAA8QA.text: Yummy food and the BEST service!  Rick was our server and was amazing!  Thank you!

pQjcChHKdVH52fEBH4hL4w.text: Wow, were we pleasantly surprised.  Our first time here even though we reside in North Phoenix. Excellent value, and so many interesting vegetarian enchilada (and other) options! From the moment we walked in, the service was great, the staff attentive, the food fresh, not overcooked, not over cheesed, nor over sauced.... perfect! The least expensive glass of wine I've had out (under $4 and generously poured, and unexpectedly tasty for a house wine)! We will definitely be back...

JPi2OE5QTe7GdvUik7cbFA.text: This restaurant appears to be well known to the locals but hidden to tourists. We just happened to find it when visiting and were pleasantly surprised.   The waiter and others on staff were very friendly. I had the spinach con papas (potatoes) enchilada with rice and black beans and my husband had the veggie fajitas. Both dishes were delicious and plentiful. We were served 2 salsas, both homemade and delicious. The chips were good. I had a frozen margarita that was just average. I wouldn't order it again, but would try on the rocks. The flavor was ok, but I had lots of shaved ice left over.   We made special dietary requests (vegan) and they were happy to accommodate us.   We ate in the bar and it was fun. They had a jukebox with every type of music that you can imagine and TVs. It's not a fancy place, but very homey, comfortable, and affordable.

uGn37SVxCvBz3u1B03aCTw.text: Not a huge fan of this place, although the $.99 margaritas are pretty good.  Great place to come on a Friday afternoon for a liquid lunch.  I though their food was bland for Mexican and rather uninspired.    If you aren't a huge Tequila fan, there are better laces out there in Phoenix.

2_Fc-ZIIwPa49jYoBEBeQg.text: I discovered this place on the recommendation of one of my coworkers about 4 months ago, and it has become my definite favorite hole in the wall mexican place, with very flavorful, smooth, red enchilada sauce and very fresh, large portions.  This is a lunch stop for me (you won't catch me in this area at night...), there is a beef quesadilla that is excellent or the mucho macho burrito will definitely fill you up, both for under $7.  The service can be brusque, but to be honest for this type of place I really don't want to interact with the servers any more than to give my order and ask for more of their salsa...

fbu1IWwZxEnqTY0CbYhp8A.text: I love this place. It is our consistent meat the Caris' joint at least one night a week. Chicken Quesadilla for the kids, burritos, enchiladas and baskets of mini tacos for the big kids. Plus a $3 margarita or three... the first time we went for a business meeting our server was about 150 years old, but bless her sassy heart she was fun and had no patience for us until we sassed her right back, then she was great. Since then, the younger staff has been great, even when we wipe them out of chips!

Vy_LpSvwTQzBR5wgCX6hDw.text: I have gone to a lot of mexican restaurants and being mexican i know how real mexican food tastes and Via Delosantos is the closest one ever. I love enchiladas and i was never satisfied until i found Via Delosantos. So if im craving enchiladas i know exactly where to go.

XOUx1F5eUM3bDpaAUlXQfQ.text: OK, i love this place.. i really do, but as you will read from other Yelpers, its not always the best.. i kid you not, when i first moved to Phoenix i noticed this building,and i have lived in phoenix for 21 years.. finally i went in, and i love it. then i turned 21 and i really loved it!! the margaritas are fabulous!!! the salsa is BOMB! the food,its good, the service..S L O W, but friendly and helpful. but really give this place a try, its good stuff!!!

qm4h7Up3XkECXp6pTQ9DJQ.text: This has become a regular spot to meet friends for dinner and margaritas. Food is great, prices are awesome and the margaritas rank amoung the best in the city.

AZfXtY-DmBY24nnZvS1NKA.text: After Don Jose's on 36th Street and Thomas closed, I spent a year at home in tears, venturing out to eat mexican food very rarely, and then a friend of a friend turned me on to Via.  This has been my saving grace, and the variety on their menu makes it easy to take even the pickiest of my friends.  Being a fairly routine person myself, I regularly enjoy their mexican pizza, but have also tried and enjoyed their chalupas, tostadas, burros and enchiladas.  It's difficult to get a seat in here on a Friday or Saturday night, but I'm usually there in the early evening on a Friday for a much needed (and very affordable!) margarita!  Definitely a great little hole on the wall place!

lYduEIx-sojYDwSkByZ9Lg.text: The margaritas are always strong and the food is great. The service lacks at times, but everything else makes up for it!!

TqLrLXOA9_tWKXnop0MYpQ.text: Took the hubby and our 2 grown sons here for dinner last night. We were seated right away, and our server was very sweet and on the spot.  The chips were thin and salty, but ours were a little on the greasy side.  The salsa is good and the food is very tasty.  I had a Machaca beef chimi;  great flavor and all the fixins on top, but the meat needed to be cut up a little more...My son and I thought the meat was to stringy. My other son, he had the cheese enchiladas and beef taco...EXCELLENT.  House Margarita's where YUMMY, YUMMY! All in all, we went home "happy gringos" with our bellies FULL.

_iuYhLrTt8r0ZC06rMeKng.text: We love it here!  We usually sit in the cantina because it's more fun and the bartender provides great service.  The margaritas are good and amazingly cheap - not just during happy hour!  Food tip: no matter what you order, you should have them put fundido sauce on it.

kErggULKj-5-VvwAVGvcWw.text: The food is the best in the area, been trying Mexican fair in the Valley for 20+ years, can't beat it!  The service is friendly and down to earth people.  Once they know you they welcome you every time!  There are no fancy frills here, just great food , oh and the best pitchers of margarita's we've ever had!  Go and check out the needle in the haystack!

LY_-kz-Oh-3frVXT7BgV_g.text: Our favorite Phoenix Mexican place. Best salsa in town,!  We have been coming here weekly for over 10 years and look forward to another 10, it is that good. Service is OK but it is all about great local food.

eTjOOmLALy_mws5wTQ7UIQ.text: love via delosantos - good friend GREAT customer service!

NenDodwXi58-vb06A2t8YQ.text: If you are in a rush and need to get in eat and get out, Via is not the place for you!  I've been here 6-7 times and every single time the service has been so slow!  I'm pretty understanding when you are short staff'd and all, because one time it was pretty apparent no one showed up for work that day. Seriously, I saw our waitress once in 10-15 minutes, and it was during the day, so there were not that many people there.  It was a little embarassing because I'm pretty sure I suggested the place, to a couple of people who had never been.  That was just one time though, but I will admit, they are pretty slow all the time. I can handle the service so anytime I'm in the area, this is the first place I suggest, because I really do like the food though. Its similar to the mexican food I grew up on at La Palma, which is now a CSV, so any mexican place I eat at is compared to LaPalma.  I miss you LaPalma, especially your take home Hot Sauce mix!  I've only been here once at "diner" time, and it was packed!!!  I usually go for some lunch, to sit in the tiny bar area with my corona, lite of course.  I need to go back on a cool day to sit on the patio and try the margarita's enjoying the fact that I will not have a waitress/waiter bugging me all the time.

Th9D72MtGXaw9vQ2oG-ewQ.text: I went here for lunch today with a large group of friends (15).  I didn't hear any complaints about the food.  My chorizo con huevos burrito was good, but not great.  I ordered it with the green chili sauce and it was bland.  I ordered a "top shelf" margarita and specified Patron Silver tequila, but I'd bet that wasn't what was in my glass.  I couldn't really tell because it was an extremely light pour.  And the service...OMG!  Everybody working there moves at a positively glacial pace!  I had to ask repeatedly for water, salsa, etc.  And I didn't even consider a to-go box.  The final straw was when the busboy scraped leftovers from a stack of plates onto my plate right in front of me! Yuck!  That was disgusting!  I had intended to check out this place for happy hour, but unless I just want to sip tequila (after I watch the bartender pour it), I'll go elsewhere.  I don't understand what all the rave reviews are about.

0yEs8LjPMt5-0mMbWEz4bw.text: great food and service we love to go all the time. gets crowded and sometimes parking is hard to find. but its worth it.

LQXF_uWJ6UxR7Sv4itlLMA.text: Kinda pricey for the size of portions. Very loud due to the fact many teenagers hang out for hours.
